data: {"title":"Ruben Amorim 'worry' reinforces Man United reality but there is no need to panic","description":"Manchester United are just two matches into the Ruben Amorim era at Old Trafford but already the critics are circling","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-worry-shows-size-30487760","content":"Ruben Amorim 'worry' shows size of task at Manchester United but there is no need to panic - Jack Flintham - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                    

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

Ruben Amorim 'worry' shows size of task at Manchester United but there is no need to panic
==========================================================================================

Manchester United are just two matches into the Ruben Amorim era at Old Trafford but already the critics are circling
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments1](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-worry-shows-size-30487760#comments-wrapper "Comments")

![Image 1: Jack Flintham](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article25393852.ece/ALTERNATES/s98/0_jack-flintham.jpg)

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

[Jack Flintham](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/jack-flintham/)Sport Central Audience Writer

*   20:30, 30 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 2: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30487984.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2187478190.jpg)

Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim (Image: James Gill - Danehouse/Getty Images)

![Image 3: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Manchester United's start under Ruben Amorim has been modest to say the least.

While the change in formation and new roles for some United players has been drastic, the performances have not yet altered dramatically. At Ipswich Town, [the Reds](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) were on fire in the opening 90 seconds but soon the frailties of the squad rose to the surface with a draw the fair result.

On Thursday night it looked for 20 minutes like it would be a bleak debut for [Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) as Bodo/Glimt stunned the hosts with two good goals. But United settled with [Rasmus Hojlund](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/rasmus-hojlund) becoming the hero to secure a big three points in the context of their [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league) campaign.

**READ MORE: [Amorim could unleash new midfield vs Everton](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-could-unleash-new-30486680)**

**READ MORE: [Casemiro reveals how dressing room has reacted to Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/casemiro-reveals-how-manchester-united-30486654)**

Neither result should have sparked too strong a reaction from supporters. Ultimately, Amorim's reign is still in its infancy so to expect drastic improvements so soon is unrealistic as is being able to draw meaningful conclusions on whether the Portuguese head coach will be a success or not.

However, that did not stop former Arsenal man Paul Merson venting his opinion on [Sky Sports' Soccer Saturday](https://www.skysports.com/soccer-saturday). "It shocked me how far they are off," he said.

"When they went 1-0 up against Ipswich within one or two minutes, you think then: 'Here we go, they are going to keep the ball and get their confidence up.' You are 1-0 up away from home, within about two or three minutes Ipswich nearly scored and it was like... there is so much work to be done.

"My biggest worry out of all of it was the interview after, when he said: 'That's it now, I have never done so many interviews, now I have got to concentrate on the team.' No, you are the manager of one of the biggest clubs in world football, you will do interviews when they ask you to do interviews and you are told to do interviews.

"That was the one worry I think they have got to cope with. When you are in Portuguese football, you will do an interview here and there and they wheel along.

  

![Image 4: Sky Sports pundit Paul Merson](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30487972.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_GettyImages-2152069342.jpg)

Sky Sports pundit Paul Merson

"He will have the press in the palm of his hand because he is winning every week and they will want a bit of him. Now he's got to be keeping them happy at the same time."

Of course, it is a culture shock for Amorim adjusting to the demands of the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) and United but there is no sign at this stage that he is either out of his depth or unable to adjust in the future. [Merson's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/paul-merson) worries would be cause for concern two years into his reign, not two games.

Whatever happens on Sunday against Everton, it is important not to jump to conclusions. This is a long-term project not a short-term fix and United fans need not be concerned by teething issues in the team or with the manager.

How Man United's starting XI could look after summer revamp with Geovany Quenda and four signings
=================================================================================================

The summer transfer window will be a crucial time for Ruben Amorim as he looks to create his perfect Manchester United team under his formation
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/how-man-uniteds-starting-xi-30485306#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

Will Jenkins

*   07:30, 30 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Geovany Quenda of Sporting Lisbon has been linked with Manchester United](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30340680.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_JS350802653.jpg)

Geovany Quenda of Sporting Lisbon has been linked with Manchester United (Image: Gualter Fatia/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

[Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) are set to have a busy time in the transfer window in the summer, when the team could face a big revamp under new head coach [Ruben Amorim.](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim)

The Portuguese manager won his first game as manager of United on Thursday night. Along with being his first match at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford), a 3-2 win in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league) against Bode/Glimt gave Amorim his first taste of success in England.

Amorim brought along his iconic three-back formation to Manchester. It's been clear that the players are still having to get used to it. However, with all new managers, Amorim will have a list of players that he wants to bring in to suit his tactics.

**READ MORE:** [Liverpool suffer major Premier League title race injury blow ahead of Man City clash](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/liverpool-suffer-major-premier-league-30484425)

**READ MORE:** [Why 'Netflix of Football' is a step closer after Premier League clubs make significant decision](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/netflix-football-step-closer-after-30483231)

We have rounded up the six key possible signings that could change the dynamic of Manchester United.

### **Geovany Quenda**

The 17-year-old is a player who Amorim adores from his Sporting CP days. Quenda would be following the likes of [Cristiano Ronaldo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/cristiano-ronaldo) and [Bruno Fernandes](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/bruno-fernandes) if he changes the green and white stripes of Libson for the red of United.

The Portuguese manager handed the youngster his debut in August and the wing-back has played every game since. Wing-backs are essential to Amorim's shape as they have the important job to manage the attack down the ring whilst still maintaining their defensive duties.

  

![Image 3: Geovany Quenda](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30414028.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/1_JS350813746.jpg)

Geovany Quenda could be on his way to Manchester with both United and City believed to be keen (Image: Carlos Rodrigues/Getty Images)

The key thing with this potential signing is that Amorim trusts Quenda. Their relationship could look to build into the kind of connection Ronaldo and [Sir Alex Ferguson](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/sir-alex-ferguson) had. Reports are that the 17-year-old has a £83m release clause in his contract which could be an issue - although the MEN reported on Friday that [United representatives have already met with the player's agent Jorge Mendes ahead of a potential move.](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/manchester-united-meet-geovany-quendas-30482307)

### **Christopher Nkunku**

The [Chelsea](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/chelsea-fc) forward is claimed to be a player of interest to United by [TEAMtalk](https://www.teamtalk.com/news/man-utd-transfers-rival-dortmund-frustrated-chelsea-ace-perfect-ruben-amorim-signing-sources). The French international hasn't had the easiest start to his time at the Blues. A knee injury had him out of play last season for a good chunk of the year. Now fit and ready, he is still only experiencing a small amount of minutes, mainly appearing in the Conference League.

Again, Nkunku would be an ideal move for Amorim as he has experience playing with a three back during his time at RB Leipzig. Although he is now primarily used a winger, Nkunku has had experience in a centre forward role, a position which Amorim is experimenting with as seen when he put [Marcus Rashford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/marcus-rashford) up front against Ipswich, as well as in attacking midfield - a role former United interim boss [Ralf Rangnick previously praised him for being 'one of the best' at.](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-united-sent-clear-53m-30468659)

A permanent move away from Chelsea looks like an unlikely scenario, however, a loan move in January could be on the table with the Frenchman unhappy in London.

### **Viktor Gyokeres**

One of the hottest strikers on the market, Gyokeres has a fantastic relationship with Amorim already from Sporting. Under the Portuguese boss, the striker managed 16 goals in 11 league games. So not only does the Swedish forward know how to play to Amorim's dynamic, but the boss understands how to get the most out of his forward.

In Amorim's first two games, he has played with two different central strikers in Rashford and [Rasmus Hojlund](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/rasmus-hojlund). Hojlund has been the most successful, grabbing a brace in the Europa League on Thursday.

Bringing the Swede into United would put the £100m+ signings of Hojlund and [Joshua Zirkzee](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/joshua-zirkzee) in jeopardy, but performances can pay.

### **Matheus Cunha**

Another striker is [Wolves](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/wolverhampton-wanderers-fc)' main man Cunha. The Midlands side have just picked up their season, grabbing their first two wins in a row recently. Now, with manager Gary O'Neil having a further understanding of where gaps may lie, bringing in reinforcements may require big names like Cunha being sold.

  

![Image 4: Matheus Cunha](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30467415.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_GettyImages-2186769955.jpg)

Matheus Cunha has been linked with a move to Manchester United in the past (Image: Jack Thomas)

The striker had cost Wolves £43m and they will likely be looking at making a profit from the Brazilian. Although Wolves are 17th, Cunha has bagged 7 goals from 12 games, more than the likes of Ollie Watkins, Bukayo Saka and Luis Diaz.

Amorim will be smart enough to not overload his attacking options. Cunha has been known to play in attacking midfield, however, which could hint at a new role for captain Bruno Fernandes if [TBR Football reports](http://iftbrfootballreportsofunited'sinterestinthebrazilianprovetobetrue,/) of United's interest in the Brazilian prove to be true,.

### **Rayan Ait-Nouri**

It looks like it could be double Wolves' for Amorim as the Algerian star Ait-Nouri has captured his eye. The defenders contract is set to expire in the summer of 2026 with [The Sun](https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/31913903/man-utd-amorim-transfer-wolves-ait-nouri/) claiming that he wants a move away from the club.

The Portuguese manager is certainly looking to expand his defensive options, especially those at left-back. The Wolves wing-back has proven himself a force to be reckoned with on the attack, frequently getting into a position to put a ball in the box, something that a player like Hojlund would certainly take advantage of.

An important factor is the fear of relegation for Wolves. Although they have collected a couple of wins recently, they still only sit one spot above relegation thanks to a better goal difference. It's certain that Ait-Nouri would prefer European football to Championship.

### **Verdict**

Amorim would certainly have some exciting options at his disposal should he pull off a major summer revamp at United. Should that happen, United's starting XI next season could be: Onana; Yoro, De Ligt, Martinez; Mazraoui, Fernandes, Ugarte, Ait-Nouri; Nkunku, Cunha; Gyokeres.

===============
                                   

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

How Man United's starting XI could look after summer revamp with Geovany Quenda and four signings
=================================================================================================

The summer transfer window will be a crucial time for Ruben Amorim as he looks to create his perfect Manchester United team under his formation
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments2](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/how-man-uniteds-starting-xi-30485306#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

Will Jenkins

*   07:30, 30 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Geovany Quenda of Sporting Lisbon has been linked with Manchester United](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30340680.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_JS350802653.jpg)

Geovany Quenda of Sporting Lisbon has been linked with Manchester United (Image: Gualter Fatia/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

[Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) are set to have a busy time in the transfer window in the summer, when the team could face a big revamp under new head coach [Ruben Amorim.](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim)

The Portuguese manager won his first game as manager of United on Thursday night. Along with being his first match at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford), a 3-2 win in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league) against Bode/Glimt gave Amorim his first taste of success in England.

Amorim brought along his iconic three-back formation to Manchester. It's been clear that the players are still having to get used to it. However, with all new managers, Amorim will have a list of players that he wants to bring in to suit his tactics.

**READ MORE:** [Liverpool suffer major Premier League title race injury blow ahead of Man City clash](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/liverpool-suffer-major-premier-league-30484425)

**READ MORE:** [Why 'Netflix of Football' is a step closer after Premier League clubs make significant decision](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/netflix-football-step-closer-after-30483231)

We have rounded up the six key possible signings that could change the dynamic of Manchester United.

### **Geovany Quenda**

The 17-year-old is a player who Amorim adores from his Sporting CP days. Quenda would be following the likes of [Cristiano Ronaldo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/cristiano-ronaldo) and [Bruno Fernandes](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/bruno-fernandes) if he changes the green and white stripes of Libson for the red of United.

The Portuguese manager handed the youngster his debut in August and the wing-back has played every game since. Wing-backs are essential to Amorim's shape as they have the important job to manage the attack down the ring whilst still maintaining their defensive duties.

  

![Image 3: Geovany Quenda](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30414028.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/1_JS350813746.jpg)

Geovany Quenda could be on his way to Manchester with both United and City believed to be keen (Image: Carlos Rodrigues/Getty Images)

The key thing with this potential signing is that Amorim trusts Quenda. Their relationship could look to build into the kind of connection Ronaldo and [Sir Alex Ferguson](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/sir-alex-ferguson) had. Reports are that the 17-year-old has a £83m release clause in his contract which could be an issue - although the MEN reported on Friday that [United representatives have already met with the player's agent Jorge Mendes ahead of a potential move.](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/manchester-united-meet-geovany-quendas-30482307)

### **Christopher Nkunku**

The [Chelsea](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/chelsea-fc) forward is claimed to be a player of interest to United by [TEAMtalk](https://www.teamtalk.com/news/man-utd-transfers-rival-dortmund-frustrated-chelsea-ace-perfect-ruben-amorim-signing-sources). The French international hasn't had the easiest start to his time at the Blues. A knee injury had him out of play last season for a good chunk of the year. Now fit and ready, he is still only experiencing a small amount of minutes, mainly appearing in the Conference League.

Again, Nkunku would be an ideal move for Amorim as he has experience playing with a three back during his time at RB Leipzig. Although he is now primarily used a winger, Nkunku has had experience in a centre forward role, a position which Amorim is experimenting with as seen when he put [Marcus Rashford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/marcus-rashford) up front against Ipswich, as well as in attacking midfield - a role former United interim boss [Ralf Rangnick previously praised him for being 'one of the best' at.](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-united-sent-clear-53m-30468659)

A permanent move away from Chelsea looks like an unlikely scenario, however, a loan move in January could be on the table with the Frenchman unhappy in London.

### **Viktor Gyokeres**

One of the hottest strikers on the market, Gyokeres has a fantastic relationship with Amorim already from Sporting. Under the Portuguese boss, the striker managed 16 goals in 11 league games. So not only does the Swedish forward know how to play to Amorim's dynamic, but the boss understands how to get the most out of his forward.

In Amorim's first two games, he has played with two different central strikers in Rashford and [Rasmus Hojlund](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/rasmus-hojlund). Hojlund has been the most successful, grabbing a brace in the Europa League on Thursday.

Bringing the Swede into United would put the £100m+ signings of Hojlund and [Joshua Zirkzee](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/joshua-zirkzee) in jeopardy, but performances can pay.

### **Matheus Cunha**

Another striker is [Wolves](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/wolverhampton-wanderers-fc)' main man Cunha. The Midlands side have just picked up their season, grabbing their first two wins in a row recently. Now, with manager Gary O'Neil having a further understanding of where gaps may lie, bringing in reinforcements may require big names like Cunha being sold.

  

![Image 4: Matheus Cunha](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30467415.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_GettyImages-2186769955.jpg)

Matheus Cunha has been linked with a move to Manchester United in the past (Image: Jack Thomas)

The striker had cost Wolves £43m and they will likely be looking at making a profit from the Brazilian. Although Wolves are 17th, Cunha has bagged 7 goals from 12 games, more than the likes of Ollie Watkins, Bukayo Saka and Luis Diaz.

Amorim will be smart enough to not overload his attacking options. Cunha has been known to play in attacking midfield, however, which could hint at a new role for captain Bruno Fernandes if [TBR Football reports](http://iftbrfootballreportsofunited'sinterestinthebrazilianprovetobetrue,/) of United's interest in the Brazilian prove to be true,.

### **Rayan Ait-Nouri**

It looks like it could be double Wolves' for Amorim as the Algerian star Ait-Nouri has captured his eye. The defenders contract is set to expire in the summer of 2026 with [The Sun](https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/31913903/man-utd-amorim-transfer-wolves-ait-nouri/) claiming that he wants a move away from the club.

The Portuguese manager is certainly looking to expand his defensive options, especially those at left-back. The Wolves wing-back has proven himself a force to be reckoned with on the attack, frequently getting into a position to put a ball in the box, something that a player like Hojlund would certainly take advantage of.

An important factor is the fear of relegation for Wolves. Although they have collected a couple of wins recently, they still only sit one spot above relegation thanks to a better goal difference. It's certain that Ait-Nouri would prefer European football to Championship.

### **Verdict**

Amorim would certainly have some exciting options at his disposal should he pull off a major summer revamp at United. Should that happen, United's starting XI next season could be: Onana; Yoro, De Ligt, Martinez; Mazraoui, Fernandes, Ugarte, Ait-Nouri; Nkunku, Cunha; Gyokeres.

[Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) are set to have a busy time in the transfer window in the summer, when the team could face a big revamp under new head coach [Ruben Amorim.](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim)

The Portuguese manager won his first game as manager of United on Thursday night. Along with being his first match at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford), a 3-2 win in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league) against Bode/Glimt gave Amorim his first taste of success in England.

Amorim brought along his iconic three-back formation to Manchester. It's been clear that the players are still having to get used to it. However, with all new managers, Amorim will have a list of players that he wants to bring in to suit his tactics.

**READ MORE:** [Liverpool suffer major Premier League title race injury blow ahead of Man City clash](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/liverpool-suffer-major-premier-league-30484425)

**READ MORE:** [Why 'Netflix of Football' is a step closer after Premier League clubs make significant decision](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/netflix-football-step-closer-after-30483231)

We have rounded up the six key possible signings that could change the dynamic of Manchester United.

### **Geovany Quenda**

The 17-year-old is a player who Amorim adores from his Sporting CP days. Quenda would be following the likes of [Cristiano Ronaldo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/cristiano-ronaldo) and [Bruno Fernandes](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/bruno-fernandes) if he changes the green and white stripes of Libson for the red of United.

The Portuguese manager handed the youngster his debut in August and the wing-back has played every game since. Wing-backs are essential to Amorim's shape as they have the important job to manage the attack down the ring whilst still maintaining their defensive duties.

  

![Image 3: Geovany Quenda](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30414028.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/1_JS350813746.jpg)

Geovany Quenda could be on his way to Manchester with both United and City believed to be keen (Image: Carlos Rodrigues/Getty Images)

The key thing with this potential signing is that Amorim trusts Quenda. Their relationship could look to build into the kind of connection Ronaldo and [Sir Alex Ferguson](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/sir-alex-ferguson) had. Reports are that the 17-year-old has a £83m release clause in his contract which could be an issue - although the MEN reported on Friday that [United representatives have already met with the player's agent Jorge Mendes ahead of a potential move.](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/manchester-united-meet-geovany-quendas-30482307)

### **Christopher Nkunku**

The [Chelsea](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/chelsea-fc) forward is claimed to be a player of interest to United by [TEAMtalk](https://www.teamtalk.com/news/man-utd-transfers-rival-dortmund-frustrated-chelsea-ace-perfect-ruben-amorim-signing-sources). The French international hasn't had the easiest start to his time at the Blues. A knee injury had him out of play last season for a good chunk of the year. Now fit and ready, he is still only experiencing a small amount of minutes, mainly appearing in the Conference League.

Again, Nkunku would be an ideal move for Amorim as he has experience playing with a three back during his time at RB Leipzig. Although he is now primarily used a winger, Nkunku has had experience in a centre forward role, a position which Amorim is experimenting with as seen when he put [Marcus Rashford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/marcus-rashford) up front against Ipswich, as well as in attacking midfield - a role former United interim boss [Ralf Rangnick previously praised him for being 'one of the best' at.](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-united-sent-clear-53m-30468659)

A permanent move away from Chelsea looks like an unlikely scenario, however, a loan move in January could be on the table with the Frenchman unhappy in London.

### **Viktor Gyokeres**

One of the hottest strikers on the market, Gyokeres has a fantastic relationship with Amorim already from Sporting. Under the Portuguese boss, the striker managed 16 goals in 11 league games. So not only does the Swedish forward know how to play to Amorim's dynamic, but the boss understands how to get the most out of his forward.

In Amorim's first two games, he has played with two different central strikers in Rashford and [Rasmus Hojlund](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/rasmus-hojlund). Hojlund has been the most successful, grabbing a brace in the Europa League on Thursday.

Bringing the Swede into United would put the £100m+ signings of Hojlund and [Joshua Zirkzee](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/joshua-zirkzee) in jeopardy, but performances can pay.

### **Matheus Cunha**

Another striker is [Wolves](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/wolverhampton-wanderers-fc)' main man Cunha. The Midlands side have just picked up their season, grabbing their first two wins in a row recently. Now, with manager Gary O'Neil having a further understanding of where gaps may lie, bringing in reinforcements may require big names like Cunha being sold.

  

![Image 4: Matheus Cunha](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30467415.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_GettyImages-2186769955.jpg)

Matheus Cunha has been linked with a move to Manchester United in the past (Image: Jack Thomas)

The striker had cost Wolves £43m and they will likely be looking at making a profit from the Brazilian. Although Wolves are 17th, Cunha has bagged 7 goals from 12 games, more than the likes of Ollie Watkins, Bukayo Saka and Luis Diaz.

Amorim will be smart enough to not overload his attacking options. Cunha has been known to play in attacking midfield, however, which could hint at a new role for captain Bruno Fernandes if [TBR Football reports](http://iftbrfootballreportsofunited'sinterestinthebrazilianprovetobetrue,/) of United's interest in the Brazilian prove to be true,.

### **Rayan Ait-Nouri**

It looks like it could be double Wolves' for Amorim as the Algerian star Ait-Nouri has captured his eye. The defenders contract is set to expire in the summer of 2026 with [The Sun](https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/31913903/man-utd-amorim-transfer-wolves-ait-nouri/) claiming that he wants a move away from the club.

The Portuguese manager is certainly looking to expand his defensive options, especially those at left-back. The Wolves wing-back has proven himself a force to be reckoned with on the attack, frequently getting into a position to put a ball in the box, something that a player like Hojlund would certainly take advantage of.

An important factor is the fear of relegation for Wolves. Although they have collected a couple of wins recently, they still only sit one spot above relegation thanks to a better goal difference. It's certain that Ait-Nouri would prefer European football to Championship.

### **Verdict**

Amorim would certainly have some exciting options at his disposal should he pull off a major summer revamp at United. Should that happen, United's starting XI next season could be: Onana; Yoro, De Ligt, Martinez; Mazraoui, Fernandes, Ugarte, Ait-Nouri; Nkunku, Cunha; Gyokeres.

[Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) are set to have a busy time in the transfer window in the summer, when the team could face a big revamp under new head coach [Ruben Amorim.](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim)

The Portuguese manager won his first game as manager of United on Thursday night. Along with being his first match at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford), a 3-2 win in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league) against Bode/Glimt gave Amorim his first taste of success in England.

Amorim brought along his iconic three-back formation to Manchester. It's been clear that the players are still having to get used to it. However, with all new managers, Amorim will have a list of players that he wants to bring in to suit his tactics.

**READ MORE:** [Liverpool suffer major Premier League title race injury blow ahead of Man City clash](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/liverpool-suffer-major-premier-league-30484425)

**READ MORE:** [Why 'Netflix of Football' is a step closer after Premier League clubs make significant decision](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/netflix-football-step-closer-after-30483231)

We have rounded up the six key possible signings that could change the dynamic of Manchester United.

### **Geovany Quenda**

The 17-year-old is a player who Amorim adores from his Sporting CP days. Quenda would be following the likes of [Cristiano Ronaldo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/cristiano-ronaldo) and [Bruno Fernandes](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/bruno-fernandes) if he changes the green and white stripes of Libson for the red of United.

The Portuguese manager handed the youngster his debut in August and the wing-back has played every game since. Wing-backs are essential to Amorim's shape as they have the important job to manage the attack down the ring whilst still maintaining their defensive duties.

  

![Image 64: Geovany Quenda](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30414028.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/1_JS350813746.jpg)

Geovany Quenda could be on his way to Manchester with both United and City believed to be keen (Image: Carlos Rodrigues/Getty Images)

The key thing with this potential signing is that Amorim trusts Quenda. Their relationship could look to build into the kind of connection Ronaldo and [Sir Alex Ferguson](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/sir-alex-ferguson) had. Reports are that the 17-year-old has a £83m release clause in his contract which could be an issue - although the MEN reported on Friday that [United representatives have already met with the player's agent Jorge Mendes ahead of a potential move.](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/manchester-united-meet-geovany-quendas-30482307)

### **Christopher Nkunku**

The [Chelsea](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/chelsea-fc) forward is claimed to be a player of interest to United by [TEAMtalk](https://www.teamtalk.com/news/man-utd-transfers-rival-dortmund-frustrated-chelsea-ace-perfect-ruben-amorim-signing-sources). The French international hasn't had the easiest start to his time at the Blues. A knee injury had him out of play last season for a good chunk of the year. Now fit and ready, he is still only experiencing a small amount of minutes, mainly appearing in the Conference League.

Again, Nkunku would be an ideal move for Amorim as he has experience playing with a three back during his time at RB Leipzig. Although he is now primarily used a winger, Nkunku has had experience in a centre forward role, a position which Amorim is experimenting with as seen when he put [Marcus Rashford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/marcus-rashford) up front against Ipswich, as well as in attacking midfield - a role former United interim boss [Ralf Rangnick previously praised him for being 'one of the best' at.](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-united-sent-clear-53m-30468659)

A permanent move away from Chelsea looks like an unlikely scenario, however, a loan move in January could be on the table with the Frenchman unhappy in London.

### **Viktor Gyokeres**

One of the hottest strikers on the market, Gyokeres has a fantastic relationship with Amorim already from Sporting. Under the Portuguese boss, the striker managed 16 goals in 11 league games. So not only does the Swedish forward know how to play to Amorim's dynamic, but the boss understands how to get the most out of his forward.

In Amorim's first two games, he has played with two different central strikers in Rashford and [Rasmus Hojlund](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/rasmus-hojlund). Hojlund has been the most successful, grabbing a brace in the Europa League on Thursday.

Bringing the Swede into United would put the £100m+ signings of Hojlund and [Joshua Zirkzee](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/joshua-zirkzee) in jeopardy, but performances can pay.

### **Matheus Cunha**

Another striker is [Wolves](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/wolverhampton-wanderers-fc)' main man Cunha. The Midlands side have just picked up their season, grabbing their first two wins in a row recently. Now, with manager Gary O'Neil having a further understanding of where gaps may lie, bringing in reinforcements may require big names like Cunha being sold.

  

![Image 65: Matheus Cunha](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30467415.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_GettyImages-2186769955.jpg)

Matheus Cunha has been linked with a move to Manchester United in the past (Image: Jack Thomas)

The striker had cost Wolves £43m and they will likely be looking at making a profit from the Brazilian. Although Wolves are 17th, Cunha has bagged 7 goals from 12 games, more than the likes of Ollie Watkins, Bukayo Saka and Luis Diaz.

Amorim will be smart enough to not overload his attacking options. Cunha has been known to play in attacking midfield, however, which could hint at a new role for captain Bruno Fernandes if [TBR Football reports](http://iftbrfootballreportsofunited'sinterestinthebrazilianprovetobetrue,/) of United's interest in the Brazilian prove to be true,.

### **Rayan Ait-Nouri**

It looks like it could be double Wolves' for Amorim as the Algerian star Ait-Nouri has captured his eye. The defenders contract is set to expire in the summer of 2026 with [The Sun](https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/31913903/man-utd-amorim-transfer-wolves-ait-nouri/) claiming that he wants a move away from the club.

The Portuguese manager is certainly looking to expand his defensive options, especially those at left-back. The Wolves wing-back has proven himself a force to be reckoned with on the attack, frequently getting into a position to put a ball in the box, something that a player like Hojlund would certainly take advantage of.

An important factor is the fear of relegation for Wolves. Although they have collected a couple of wins recently, they still only sit one spot above relegation thanks to a better goal difference. It's certain that Ait-Nouri would prefer European football to Championship.

### **Verdict**

Amorim would certainly have some exciting options at his disposal should he pull off a major summer revamp at United. Should that happen, United's starting XI next season could be: Onana; Yoro, De Ligt, Martinez; Mazraoui, Fernandes, Ugarte, Ait-Nouri; Nkunku, Cunha; Gyokeres.

Manchester United history is about to repeat itself with £72million player - and it's good news
===============================================================================================

Rasmus Hojlund scored a brace in the Europa League on Thursday night and he must kick on after that display.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

By

[Steven Railston](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/steven-railston/)Manchester United Writer

*   07:00, 30 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 2](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/article30481092.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/1_GettyImages-2187348816.jpg)

Hojlund scored twice against Bodo/Glimt. (Image: 2024 Manchester United FC)

![Image 3: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

Just as Ramsus Hojlund found his stride last season, he picked an injury that disrupted his rhythm.

[Hojlund](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/rasmus-hojlund) sustained a muscle injury against Luton Town on February 18 and confirmation that he was facing a few weeks on the sidelines came after he scored seven goals in six games.

The young striker scored in successive games against Tottenham, Newport County, Wolves, West Ham, Aston Villa and Luton but actually turned a corner before that run of games.

Hojlund had no problem scoring in the Champions League group stage, impressively scoring five times in Europe, but he had to wait until December to score his first goal in the Premier League, finally getting that monkey off his back when scoring a brace against Villa on Boxing Day.

**ALSO READ:** **[Ratcliffe must make a U-turn after United price hike](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/kick-teeth-sir-jim-ratcliffe-30475527)**

**ALSO READ: [Wonderkid Obi-Martin signs first professional contract](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-wonderkid-chido-obi-30477567)**

During the period that Hojlund hadn't scored in the league, he played it down but he was clearly relieved when he got off the mark. Shortly afterwards, Hojlund enjoyed a purple patch and United's unbeaten streak suddenly ended in the first game that he was unavailable with injury.

That didn't feel like a coincidence, although Hojlund didn't return from his injury in the same vein of form and Bruno Fernandes started as the false nine in the FA Cup final at Wembley.

It was a disappointing end to the campaign for Hojlund, who subsequently struggled for Denmark at Euro 2024 and picked up a hamstring injury in his first appearance of pre-season.

Hojlund made his comeback against [Crystal Palace at Selhurst Park](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) in September. He later scored against FC Porto and Brentford, but he was beginning to look like a player whose confidence was suffering and that's why it was so great to see him net a brace in the Europe League on Thursday night.

Alejandro Garnacho scored the opening goal against Bodo/Glimt but Hojlund created it with his aggressive pressing and his equaliser on the stroke of half-time was brilliantly taken.

  

![Image 4: Rasmus Hojlund](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/article30476684.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_GettyImages-2187360958.jpg)

There is more to come from Hojlund.

Hojund's touch to control Noussair Mazraoui's cross was superb and the finish was even better. It was tremendous goal from a technical perspective and his second goal was a 'proper striker's goal', with Hojlund sweeping home Mason Mount's low, driven cross from close range.

The smile was back on Hojlund's face when he spoke to MUTV to reflect on the performance and he described his matchwinner in the second half as the perfect "Rasmus Hojlund goal."

There is now a strong case for Hojlund to retain his starting role against Everton this weekend and history has a tendency to repeat itself, so he could be on the verge of a purple patch again.

Confidence is crucial in elite sport and strikers can be streaky creatures who go on a prolific run after a strong performance, just like Hojlund did at the start of the year. After scoring a brace on Boxing Day, Hojlund exploded into life and perhaps lightening could strike twice.

Ruben Amorim said about Hojlund in his press conference: "I think he improved the connection. I think he has to improve more because sometimes he gives too many touches when he holds the ball.

"But he’s really important for us because when we are in the low block he is the guy to hold the ball, to connect for transitions, he did that very well and he has that characteristic.

"He was aggressive in the goals, he was aggressive in the box and he is a quality player. I think he scores the most difficult goals so he has a lot to improve. Is the same for every player but he did a great job."

Hojlund said when conducting his media duties that Amorim's system suits him because he played in a similar formation with Atalanta and the pair could develop a healthy marriage.

United need Hojlund to score regularly and it feels like he's about to turn a corner again.

Man United icon Wayne Rooney suffers huge setback as Plymouth thumped again
===========================================================================

Rooney has been plying his trade down south - and it's been a tough watch wth his Plymouth Argyle side struggling after a 4-0 defeat to Bristol City in the Championship
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Ex-Manchester United legend Wayne Rooney has struggled to find the spark that would ignite his managerial career so far, with short stints at Derby County, Birmingham City and Major League Soccer side DC United ending in misery. The struggle continues at his new club, Plymouth Argyle in the Championship - where his side hover over the drop zone.

[Rooney](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/wayne-rooney) began his move from player to head coach at Derby County in 2020, quitting professional football the following year. Hit with a 21 point deduction and spending almost the whole season with the club in administration, there was little to do but go down fighting.

His next English effort was with Birmingham City, and he was sacked in a season that saw Blues slip into League One for the first time since 1995. Plymouth Argyle took a chance on Rooney as the 2023/'24 season came to a close, and he has overseen some devastating losses during his time at the club.

[Argyle fans on our sister site Plymouth Live](https://www.plymouthherald.co.uk/sport/football/wayne-rooney-plymouth-argyle-reaction-9750748) have been having their say in comments sections as the drab results continue to come in. One fan wrote: "Not holding my breath. Can't see a win coming at the next game. Another loss and Rooney should be up the road."

Another wrote: "Just resign Wayne, you dont have the solution and even if you did you couldn't implement it. So just go before you take our beloved club back to League 1, a league we tried to get out of for years."

Not all think it's solely down to Rooney - Plymouth are amongst the lowest spenders in the Championship. One fan says: "How on earth can the gaffer be blamed when Argyle have a budget lower than most league one clubs! Running a club in the Championship on a League 2 budget will only end one way... relegation."

On reader thinks that the deal should never have gone ahead: "The board will never stand up and be counted, to say all of this is their fault."

'I have a sneaky feeling' - pundits disagree on Manchester United vs Everton score prediction
=============================================================================================

Man United will be going in search of their first Premier League win under Ruben Amorim against Everton on Sunday.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

By

[George Smith](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/george-smith/)Senior Football Writer

*   18:15, 30 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Manchester United's players celebrate with Rasmus Hojlund after his goal against Bodo/Glimt.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30488306.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186679484.jpg)

Manchester United will be eyeing another victory on Sunday afternoon. (Image: Oli Scarff/AFP via Getty Images.)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Manchester United will be targeting a second successive victory when they welcome Everton to [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) on Sunday.

[United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) recorded their first win of the Ruben Amorim era in midweek, beating Bodo/Glimt 3-2 in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league). United recovered from 2-1 down to secure all three points, inspired by a [Rasmus Hojlund](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/rasmus-hojlund) brace.

Amorim will now be keen to oversee his first [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) victory as United boss after his debut in the dugout against Ipswich Town at Portman Road last weekend finished in a 1-1 draw.

**READ MORE:** **[Chido Obi-Martin marks landmark United moment by scoring again for Under-18s](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/chido-obi-martin-marks-landmark-30487111)**

**READ MORE:** **[Ruben Amorim could unleash new midfield vs Everton to give United fans what they want](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-could-unleash-new-30486680)**

United will fancy their chances of getting the better of an Everton side that has won just one of six away league games this season. But how do the pundits think the contest will unfold at Old Trafford?

**Chris Sutton - BBC Sport**

"I think the reality is hitting home about Amorim using his favoured 3-4-3 formation with their current squad - especially with Christian Eriksen and Casemiro in midfield," Sutton told [BBC Sport](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/articles/ce89x1d34zko). "As for Everton, well a fair few of their fans still seem to be on Sean Dyche's back, and they could not find a way past Brentford's 10 men last week.

"This time, they will be the team looking to hold out and I believe they can do it because this United team is going to take a while to click. Once the initial buzz of Amorim's first home game dies down, things could go flat at Old Trafford, the way it has done quite a lot recently.

"I hope it happens for them under Amorim because he seems like a decent guy, but he is in the [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) madhouse now and he is about to find out what it is like to be under the microscope every single week."

**Prediction:** _United 1-1 Everton_

**Paul Merson - Sportskeeda**

Merson, penning his prediction for [Sportskeeda](https://www.sportskeeda.com/football/news-paul-merson-predicts-liverpool-vs-manchester-city-premier-league-gw13-fixtures), wrote: "Nothing changed for Manchester United last week, in my opinion. Ipswich were by far the better team.

"I'm not entirely convinced about Manchester United's new system under Amorim. After a point in that game, you would've thought Ipswich were the bigger club and not United – that's how it went.

"You could say everyone was away on international duty and he did not have enough time. But if that performance were against one of the big boys in the league, Manchester United would have been destroyed by four or five goals.

"Everton are a team who have a special X-factor in them. They always have that one fixture every season when they just spring to life and surprise us. I'm going for a United win, but I can't help but admit that I have a sneaky feeling about Everton."

**Prediction:** _United 2-0 Everton_

**Mark Lawrenson - Paddy Power**

Everton can't stop drawing and they're certainly not scoring much," Lawrenson told [Paddy Power](https://news.paddypower.com/football/2024/11/30/football-accumulator-tips-footyaccums-best-bets-today-saturday/). "With home advantage and the crowd behind them in Ruben Amorim's first game at Old Trafford Manchester United should win this."

**Prediction:** _United 2-1 Everton_

Manchester United will be targeting a second successive victory when they welcome Everton to [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) on Sunday.

[United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) recorded their first win of the Ruben Amorim era in midweek, beating Bodo/Glimt 3-2 in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league). United recovered from 2-1 down to secure all three points, inspired by a [Rasmus Hojlund](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/rasmus-hojlund) brace.

Amorim will now be keen to oversee his first [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) victory as United boss after his debut in the dugout against Ipswich Town at Portman Road last weekend finished in a 1-1 draw.

**READ MORE:** **[Chido Obi-Martin marks landmark United moment by scoring again for Under-18s](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/chido-obi-martin-marks-landmark-30487111)**

**READ MORE:** **[Ruben Amorim could unleash new midfield vs Everton to give United fans what they want](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-could-unleash-new-30486680)**

United will fancy their chances of getting the better of an Everton side that has won just one of six away league games this season. But how do the pundits think the contest will unfold at Old Trafford?

**Chris Sutton - BBC Sport**

"I think the reality is hitting home about Amorim using his favoured 3-4-3 formation with their current squad - especially with Christian Eriksen and Casemiro in midfield," Sutton told [BBC Sport](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/articles/ce89x1d34zko). "As for Everton, well a fair few of their fans still seem to be on Sean Dyche's back, and they could not find a way past Brentford's 10 men last week.

"This time, they will be the team looking to hold out and I believe they can do it because this United team is going to take a while to click. Once the initial buzz of Amorim's first home game dies down, things could go flat at Old Trafford, the way it has done quite a lot recently.

"I hope it happens for them under Amorim because he seems like a decent guy, but he is in the [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) madhouse now and he is about to find out what it is like to be under the microscope every single week."

**Prediction:** _United 1-1 Everton_

**Paul Merson - Sportskeeda**

Merson, penning his prediction for [Sportskeeda](https://www.sportskeeda.com/football/news-paul-merson-predicts-liverpool-vs-manchester-city-premier-league-gw13-fixtures), wrote: "Nothing changed for Manchester United last week, in my opinion. Ipswich were by far the better team.

"I'm not entirely convinced about Manchester United's new system under Amorim. After a point in that game, you would've thought Ipswich were the bigger club and not United – that's how it went.

"You could say everyone was away on international duty and he did not have enough time. But if that performance were against one of the big boys in the league, Manchester United would have been destroyed by four or five goals.

"Everton are a team who have a special X-factor in them. They always have that one fixture every season when they just spring to life and surprise us. I'm going for a United win, but I can't help but admit that I have a sneaky feeling about Everton."

**Prediction:** _United 2-0 Everton_

**Mark Lawrenson - Paddy Power**

Everton can't stop drawing and they're certainly not scoring much," Lawrenson told [Paddy Power](https://news.paddypower.com/football/2024/11/30/football-accumulator-tips-footyaccums-best-bets-today-saturday/). "With home advantage and the crowd behind them in Ruben Amorim's first game at Old Trafford Manchester United should win this."

**Prediction:** _United 2-1 Everton_

'I have a sneaky feeling' - pundits disagree on Manchester United vs Everton score prediction
=============================================================================================

Man United will be going in search of their first Premier League win under Ruben Amorim against Everton on Sunday.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments2](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/i-sneaky-feeling-pundits-disagree-30488265#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[George Smith](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/george-smith/)Senior Football Writer

*   18:15, 30 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Manchester United's players celebrate with Rasmus Hojlund after his goal against Bodo/Glimt.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30488306.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186679484.jpg)

Manchester United will be eyeing another victory on Sunday afternoon. (Image: Oli Scarff/AFP via Getty Images.)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Manchester United will be targeting a second successive victory when they welcome Everton to [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) on Sunday.

[United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) recorded their first win of the Ruben Amorim era in midweek, beating Bodo/Glimt 3-2 in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league). United recovered from 2-1 down to secure all three points, inspired by a [Rasmus Hojlund](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/rasmus-hojlund) brace.

Amorim will now be keen to oversee his first [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) victory as United boss after his debut in the dugout against Ipswich Town at Portman Road last weekend finished in a 1-1 draw.

**READ MORE:** **[Chido Obi-Martin marks landmark United moment by scoring again for Under-18s](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/chido-obi-martin-marks-landmark-30487111)**

**READ MORE:** **[Ruben Amorim could unleash new midfield vs Everton to give United fans what they want](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-could-unleash-new-30486680)**

United will fancy their chances of getting the better of an Everton side that has won just one of six away league games this season. But how do the pundits think the contest will unfold at Old Trafford?

**Chris Sutton - BBC Sport**

"I think the reality is hitting home about Amorim using his favoured 3-4-3 formation with their current squad - especially with Christian Eriksen and Casemiro in midfield," Sutton told [BBC Sport](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/articles/ce89x1d34zko). "As for Everton, well a fair few of their fans still seem to be on Sean Dyche's back, and they could not find a way past Brentford's 10 men last week.

"This time, they will be the team looking to hold out and I believe they can do it because this United team is going to take a while to click. Once the initial buzz of Amorim's first home game dies down, things could go flat at Old Trafford, the way it has done quite a lot recently.

"I hope it happens for them under Amorim because he seems like a decent guy, but he is in the [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) madhouse now and he is about to find out what it is like to be under the microscope every single week."

**Prediction:** _United 1-1 Everton_

**Paul Merson - Sportskeeda**

Merson, penning his prediction for [Sportskeeda](https://www.sportskeeda.com/football/news-paul-merson-predicts-liverpool-vs-manchester-city-premier-league-gw13-fixtures), wrote: "Nothing changed for Manchester United last week, in my opinion. Ipswich were by far the better team.

"I'm not entirely convinced about Manchester United's new system under Amorim. After a point in that game, you would've thought Ipswich were the bigger club and not United – that's how it went.

"You could say everyone was away on international duty and he did not have enough time. But if that performance were against one of the big boys in the league, Manchester United would have been destroyed by four or five goals.

"Everton are a team who have a special X-factor in them. They always have that one fixture every season when they just spring to life and surprise us. I'm going for a United win, but I can't help but admit that I have a sneaky feeling about Everton."

**Prediction:** _United 2-0 Everton_

**Mark Lawrenson - Paddy Power**

Everton can't stop drawing and they're certainly not scoring much," Lawrenson told [Paddy Power](https://news.paddypower.com/football/2024/11/30/football-accumulator-tips-footyaccums-best-bets-today-saturday/). "With home advantage and the crowd behind them in Ruben Amorim's first game at Old Trafford Manchester United should win this."

**Prediction:** _United 2-1 Everton_

Manchester United will be targeting a second successive victory when they welcome Everton to [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) on Sunday.

[United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) recorded their first win of the Ruben Amorim era in midweek, beating Bodo/Glimt 3-2 in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league). United recovered from 2-1 down to secure all three points, inspired by a [Rasmus Hojlund](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/rasmus-hojlund) brace.

Amorim will now be keen to oversee his first [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) victory as United boss after his debut in the dugout against Ipswich Town at Portman Road last weekend finished in a 1-1 draw.

**READ MORE:** **[Chido Obi-Martin marks landmark United moment by scoring again for Under-18s](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/chido-obi-martin-marks-landmark-30487111)**

**READ MORE:** **[Ruben Amorim could unleash new midfield vs Everton to give United fans what they want](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-could-unleash-new-30486680)**

United will fancy their chances of getting the better of an Everton side that has won just one of six away league games this season. But how do the pundits think the contest will unfold at Old Trafford?

**Chris Sutton - BBC Sport**

"I think the reality is hitting home about Amorim using his favoured 3-4-3 formation with their current squad - especially with Christian Eriksen and Casemiro in midfield," Sutton told [BBC Sport](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/articles/ce89x1d34zko). "As for Everton, well a fair few of their fans still seem to be on Sean Dyche's back, and they could not find a way past Brentford's 10 men last week.

"This time, they will be the team looking to hold out and I believe they can do it because this United team is going to take a while to click. Once the initial buzz of Amorim's first home game dies down, things could go flat at Old Trafford, the way it has done quite a lot recently.

"I hope it happens for them under Amorim because he seems like a decent guy, but he is in the [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) madhouse now and he is about to find out what it is like to be under the microscope every single week."

**Prediction:** _United 1-1 Everton_

**Paul Merson - Sportskeeda**

Merson, penning his prediction for [Sportskeeda](https://www.sportskeeda.com/football/news-paul-merson-predicts-liverpool-vs-manchester-city-premier-league-gw13-fixtures), wrote: "Nothing changed for Manchester United last week, in my opinion. Ipswich were by far the better team.

"I'm not entirely convinced about Manchester United's new system under Amorim. After a point in that game, you would've thought Ipswich were the bigger club and not United – that's how it went.

"You could say everyone was away on international duty and he did not have enough time. But if that performance were against one of the big boys in the league, Manchester United would have been destroyed by four or five goals.

"Everton are a team who have a special X-factor in them. They always have that one fixture every season when they just spring to life and surprise us. I'm going for a United win, but I can't help but admit that I have a sneaky feeling about Everton."

**Prediction:** _United 2-0 Everton_

A Premier League streaming service, referred to as the 'Netflix of Football' or 'Premflix', which could enhance club revenues and reduce expenses for supporters, has edged closer to reality.

Many might think the most monumental decision from last Friday's [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) shareholder meeting was regarding amendments to rules on associated party transactions in another episode of the ongoing regulatory tussle with [Manchester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-city-fc).

Yet, an arguably more consequential resolution was presented to the league's 20 clubs and garnered less attention but may herald a significant shift in how fans globally engage with the most-watched football league.

**READ MORE: [Mazraoui is doing what United said he would do](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/noussair-mazraoui-doing-what-manchester-30477349)**

**READ MORE: [Amorim reveals United's drastic change in pre-match preparations for Everton](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-reveals-manchester-uniteds-30479149)**

This critical vote sealed the end of a two-decade partnership with IMG, who currently produce 6,000 hours of content every season. This includes live broadcasting of all 380 matches and various magazine programs, delivered to 55 international broadcasters across 189 markets outside of Britain.

In a pivotal step, the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) clubs have unanimously agreed to take charge of producing and distributing their media content for global audiences from 2026 onwards.

By consolidating control over production, this could set the stage for the Premier League to introduce its own direct-to-consumer streaming service, an initiative previously touted as a "Netflix of Football" or "Premflix".

The NFL and NBA have already launched their own versions of this - NFL Game Pass and NBA League Pass. Europe often follows the lead of the more commercially mature US sports market.

Paolo Pescatore of PP Foresight commented: "In the first instance it feels like taking back ownership and control under one umbrella. This then in turn opens up new opportunities of distributing that content in different ways to existing and new viewers around the world.

"The direction of travel is clear as the adoption of connected devices continues to grow; we are all now streaming some form of television at any time and anywhere thanks to the internet via fibre or mobile networks."

### Premflix 'a nice tool but not TV substitute'

A direct-to-consumer platform would offer numerous benefits to the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league). Not only would it increase reach, being available to anyone with a device, but it could also gather customer data and potentially multiply revenue.

A 2020 academic paper suggested that if the roughly 200 million people who currently subscribe to pay TV channels to watch the Premier League paid £10 a month for a dedicated streaming service, annual media rights income could skyrocket from £3.5bn to £24bn.

While this may be an idealised scenario and does not factor in the costs of creating the content, the platform on which to show it, and marketing costs it does highlight the potential financial rewards of the right product.

Francois Godard from Enders Analysis remarked on the Premier Leagues move to handle their international media rights, saying it "may be a clever move". However, he emphasized the necessity of broadcasters: "I don't see D2C \[direct to consumer\] as the future of football. Maybe it's an option you can use in certain markets," to negotiate better deals from media firms.

Further delving into American sports trends, Godard observed that long-term partnerships are formed between US leagues and broadcasters. He elaborated, saying: "I don't believe the NFL and NBA D2C platforms are a substitute for sales to broadcasters," highlighting their usefulness as: "They are a nice tool and a way to reach core fans."

Hojlund celebrates vs Bodo/Glimt

Manchester United beat Bodo/Glimt 3-2 in the Europa League on Thursday to secure Ruben Amorim’s first win at the club.

[United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) broke the deadlock less than a minute into the game as [Alejandro Garnacho](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/alejandro-garnacho) tapped home after good work from Rasmus Hojlund.

For the second game running United failed to take control of the contest having gone ahead and Bodo/Glimt equalised through Hakon Evjen before taking the lead through Philip Zinckernagel. Hojlund scored late in the first half to bring United back on level terms and then bagged his second of the game after 50 minutes to make it 3-2.

Here are how the players rated at Old Trafford:

**READ MORE: [United vs Bodo/Glimt as it happened](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-bodo-glimt-live-30468119)**

**READ MORE: [Why Leny Yoro is not training with United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/leny-yoro-not-training-manchester-30462175)**

**Andre Onana**

Well beaten by Hakon Evjen but the ball went through his legs from Philip Zinckernagel. Flirted with disaster outside his area but scrambled the ball away. 6

**Noussair Mazraoui**

Ended an uncharacteristically iffy half with a fine cross for Rasmus Hojlund to equalise. Effortlessly switched from centre back to right back in the second half. 7

**Matthijs de Ligt**

Failed to anticipate the danger after Tyrell Malacia was outsprinted in another cumbersome performance. His place should not be secure in this side. 4

**Lisandro Martinez**

Went walkabout for Bodo's second goal on his return from a back injury. Played one fine pass that led to Mason Mount's sighter before his withdrawal. 6

**Antony**

Crowbarred into the team at right wing back and did not convince, having trained in that position last week. Made way before the hour. 4

**Manuel Ugarte**

Had a different partner in fellow Sporting alumni Bruno Fernandes and the balance was not quite right. Still did well to assist Rasmus Hojlund. 6

**Bruno Fernandes**

Moved to a deeper role, where he has excelled before, but was unable to replicate that form. Not a particularly effectual evening. 5

**Tyrell Malacia**

Outpaced for Bodo's second goal in the ultimate endurance test. Overcooked crosses and had to come off at half-time. He did. 3

**Mason Mount**

Busy off the ball on his first start in 96 days and hit the crossbar early in the second half. Earned a bullish chest-bump from Amorim after he came off. 6

**Alejandro Garnacho**

Tapped into an open net after 48 seconds and found Fernandes and Mount for some good chances. Missed better chances himself. 6

**Rasmus Hojlund**

Made the first goal through his pressing and then finished adroitly to equalise just before half-time. Showed predatory instincts to put United ahead. 8

**Subs**

**Diogo Dalot**

A spirited second-half performance. 6

**Luke Shaw**

Slotted in at centre half. 6

**Amad**

Back on the right and a threat. 6

**Marcus Rashford**

Shot wide. 5

**Casemiro**

Wolves 'make' Matheus Cunha contract decision amid Man United links
===================================================================

Matheus Cunha has been one of the most in-form forwards in the Premier League this season and he has since been linked with a move to Manchester United
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Share

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/wolves-make-matheus-cunha-contract-30483915#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Kieran King](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/kieran-king/)Football Writer

*   19:30, 29 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Matheus Cunha](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30467415.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186769955.jpg)

Matheus Cunha has been linked with a move to Manchester United in the past (Image: Jack Thomas)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Wolves are set to offer Manchester United target Matheus Cunha a lucrative new contract. The Brazilian, who has been linked with a move to United, has been in fine form this season, scoring seven goals and adding three assists in 12 matches.

Cunha, 25, has two-and-a-half years on his contract having joined Wolves, initially on loan from Atletico Madrid, in January 2023. However, there has been speculation over his future with United 'monitoring' his situation following his excellent start to the campaign.

A number of other teams are expected to be interested in Cunha, but Wolves are trying their best to keep him. According to [The Telegraph](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2024/11/29/matheus-cunha-is-leading-light-of-wolves-brazilian-strategy/), the West Midlands club are set to initiate talks over improved terms and want to convince him to stay at Molineux long-term.

**ALSO READ:** **[Ratcliffe must make a U-turn after United price hike](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/kick-teeth-sir-jim-ratcliffe-30475527)**

**ALSO READ: [Wonderkid Obi-Martin signs first professional contract](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-wonderkid-chido-obi-30477567)**

It comes as Gary O'Neil addressed Cunha's future in his pre-Bournemouth press conference and claimed that their talisman "definitely won't leave" the club in January. He didn't, however, confirmed whether he might depart in move at the end of the season.

"Matheus definitely won't leave in January," O'Neil said. "Definitely not. Mine and Matheus' relationship and his understanding of what we're trying to do here is exceptionally good.

"I don't foresee there being any problems at all in January with Matheus Cunha contract-wise. But I'll leave that to the club. We have a real focus, Matheus included, on tomorrow's game and making sure we're in the best shape to beat Bournemouth, then the contract staff will obviously be handled by the football club."

Meanwhile, Cunha has previously spoken about links to United. He said: "You know it’s a real honour to have your name linked to [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc), one of the biggest clubs in the world. But I’m happy at Wolves. If I’m lucky, I'll play another good season, but the window is open, you never know."

As for United, Ruben Amorim won his first game as their new head coach on Thursday as they scraped past Bodo/Glimt in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league). Rasmus Hojlund scored twice, while Alejandro Garnacho grabbed the other as United moved up to 12th in the new league format.
