Wolves 'make' Matheus Cunha contract decision amid Man United links
===================================================================

Matheus Cunha has been one of the most in-form forwards in the Premier League this season and he has since been linked with a move to Manchester United
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/wolves-make-matheus-cunha-contract-30483915#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Kieran King](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/kieran-king/)Football Writer

*   19:30, 29 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Matheus Cunha](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30467415.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186769955.jpg)

Matheus Cunha has been linked with a move to Manchester United in the past (Image: Jack Thomas)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Wolves are set to offer Manchester United target Matheus Cunha a lucrative new contract. The Brazilian, who has been linked with a move to United, has been in fine form this season, scoring seven goals and adding three assists in 12 matches.

Cunha, 25, has two-and-a-half years on his contract having joined Wolves, initially on loan from Atletico Madrid, in January 2023. However, there has been speculation over his future with United 'monitoring' his situation following his excellent start to the campaign.

A number of other teams are expected to be interested in Cunha, but Wolves are trying their best to keep him. According to [The Telegraph](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2024/11/29/matheus-cunha-is-leading-light-of-wolves-brazilian-strategy/), the West Midlands club are set to initiate talks over improved terms and want to convince him to stay at Molineux long-term.

**ALSO READ:** **[Ratcliffe must make a U-turn after United price hike](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/kick-teeth-sir-jim-ratcliffe-30475527)**

**ALSO READ: [Wonderkid Obi-Martin signs first professional contract](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-wonderkid-chido-obi-30477567)**

It comes as Gary O'Neil addressed Cunha's future in his pre-Bournemouth press conference and claimed that their talisman "definitely won't leave" the club in January. He didn't, however, confirmed whether he might depart in move at the end of the season.

"Matheus definitely won't leave in January," O'Neil said. "Definitely not. Mine and Matheus' relationship and his understanding of what we're trying to do here is exceptionally good.

"I don't foresee there being any problems at all in January with Matheus Cunha contract-wise. But I'll leave that to the club. We have a real focus, Matheus included, on tomorrow's game and making sure we're in the best shape to beat Bournemouth, then the contract staff will obviously be handled by the football club."

Meanwhile, Cunha has previously spoken about links to United. He said: "You know it’s a real honour to have your name linked to [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc), one of the biggest clubs in the world. But I’m happy at Wolves. If I’m lucky, I'll play another good season, but the window is open, you never know."

As for United, Ruben Amorim won his first game as their new head coach on Thursday as they scraped past Bodo/Glimt in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league). Rasmus Hojlund scored twice, while Alejandro Garnacho grabbed the other as United moved up to 12th in the new league format.

data: {"title":"Wolves 'make' Matheus Cunha contract decision amid Man United links","description":"Matheus Cunha has been one of the most in-form forwards in the Premier League this season and he has since been linked with a move to Manchester United","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/wolves-make-matheus-cunha-contract-30483915","content":"Wolves 'make' Matheus Cunha contract decision amid Man United links - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                    

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Wolves 'make' Matheus Cunha contract decision amid Man United links
===================================================================

Matheus Cunha has been one of the most in-form forwards in the Premier League this season and he has since been linked with a move to Manchester United
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/wolves-make-matheus-cunha-contract-30483915#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Kieran King](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/kieran-king/)Football Writer

*   19:30, 29 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Matheus Cunha](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30467415.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186769955.jpg)

Matheus Cunha has been linked with a move to Manchester United in the past (Image: Jack Thomas)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Wolves are set to offer Manchester United target Matheus Cunha a lucrative new contract. The Brazilian, who has been linked with a move to United, has been in fine form this season, scoring seven goals and adding three assists in 12 matches.

Cunha, 25, has two-and-a-half years on his contract having joined Wolves, initially on loan from Atletico Madrid, in January 2023. However, there has been speculation over his future with United 'monitoring' his situation following his excellent start to the campaign.

A number of other teams are expected to be interested in Cunha, but Wolves are trying their best to keep him. According to [The Telegraph](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2024/11/29/matheus-cunha-is-leading-light-of-wolves-brazilian-strategy/), the West Midlands club are set to initiate talks over improved terms and want to convince him to stay at Molineux long-term.

**ALSO READ:** **[Ratcliffe must make a U-turn after United price hike](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/kick-teeth-sir-jim-ratcliffe-30475527)**

**ALSO READ: [Wonderkid Obi-Martin signs first professional contract](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-wonderkid-chido-obi-30477567)**

It comes as Gary O'Neil addressed Cunha's future in his pre-Bournemouth press conference and claimed that their talisman "definitely won't leave" the club in January. He didn't, however, confirmed whether he might depart in move at the end of the season.

"Matheus definitely won't leave in January," O'Neil said. "Definitely not. Mine and Matheus' relationship and his understanding of what we're trying to do here is exceptionally good.

"I don't foresee there being any problems at all in January with Matheus Cunha contract-wise. But I'll leave that to the club. We have a real focus, Matheus included, on tomorrow's game and making sure we're in the best shape to beat Bournemouth, then the contract staff will obviously be handled by the football club."

Meanwhile, Cunha has previously spoken about links to United. He said: "You know it’s a real honour to have your name linked to [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc), one of the biggest clubs in the world. But I’m happy at Wolves. If I’m lucky, I'll play another good season, but the window is open, you never know."

As for United, Ruben Amorim won his first game as their new head coach on Thursday as they scraped past Bodo/Glimt in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league). Rasmus Hojlund scored twice, while Alejandro Garnacho grabbed the other as United moved up to 12th in the new league format.

Wolves 'make' Matheus Cunha contract decision amid Man United links
===================================================================

Matheus Cunha has been one of the most in-form forwards in the Premier League this season and he has since been linked with a move to Manchester United
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/wolves-make-matheus-cunha-contract-30483915#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Kieran King](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/kieran-king/)Football Writer

*   19:30, 29 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Matheus Cunha](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30467415.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186769955.jpg)

Matheus Cunha has been linked with a move to Manchester United in the past (Image: Jack Thomas)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Wolves are set to offer Manchester United target Matheus Cunha a lucrative new contract. The Brazilian, who has been linked with a move to United, has been in fine form this season, scoring seven goals and adding three assists in 12 matches.

Cunha, 25, has two-and-a-half years on his contract having joined Wolves, initially on loan from Atletico Madrid, in January 2023. However, there has been speculation over his future with United 'monitoring' his situation following his excellent start to the campaign.

[](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)[Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/amorim-hojlund-keane-manchester-united-30477826?int_source=mantis_rec&int_medium=web&int_campaign=more_like_this_comments#comments-wrapper "Comments")

"I don't foresee there being any problems at all in January with Matheus Cunha contract-wise. But I'll leave that to the club. We have a real focus, Matheus included, on tomorrow's game and making sure we're in the best shape to beat Bournemouth, then the contract staff will obviously be handled by the football club."

Meanwhile, Cunha has previously spoken about links to United. He said: "You know it’s a real honour to have your name linked to [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc), one of the biggest clubs in the world. But I’m happy at Wolves. If I’m lucky, I'll play another good season, but the window is open, you never know."

As for United, Ruben Amorim won his first game as their new head coach on Thursday as they scraped past Bodo/Glimt in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league). Rasmus Hojlund scored twice, while Alejandro Garnacho grabbed the other as United moved up to 12th in the new league format.

Manchester United duo show true Ruud van Nistelrooy feelings after new job confirmed
====================================================================================

The latest Manchester United news as the former striker and United coach has joined Leicester City as first team manager.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

*   21:15, 29 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Leicester City unveil their new manager Ruud van Nistelrooy.](https://i2-prod.football.london/incoming/article30485216.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Leicester-City-Unveil-Their-New-Manager-Ruud-van-Nistelrooy.jpg)

Ruud van Nistelrooy has become the new manager of Leicester City following his exit from Manchester United. (Image: Plumb Images/Leicester City FC via Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Just over two weeks after leaving [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc), [Ruud van Nistelrooy](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruud-van-nistelrooy) has been confirmed as the new Leicester City manager.

The United legend has signed a deal until 2027, and will take charge of his first game when West Ham visit the King Power Stadium on Tuesday night. He will have a watching brief for the weekend’s clash against Brentford at the G-Tech Community Stadium.

His arrival at Leicester comes after he spent the first part of the season as assistant to [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) at United. Van Nistelrooy then took interim charge of the team for four games following the sacking of Ten Hag.

**READ MORE: [Ruud van Nistelrooy first words as new job confirmed and Man United reunion date set](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-first-words-30484872)**

**READ MORE: [Ruben Amorim's first Man United transfer move could hand Man City millions](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruben-amorims-first-man-united-30484565)**

In those games, United won three and drew just one. Ironically, two of the wins came against Leicester, [a 5-2 victory in the Carabao Cup](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-player-ratings-vs-30265661) and [a 3-0 win](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-player-ratings-amad-30338793) in the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league).

Leicester made the decision to make a managerial change on Sunday when they parted ways with Steve Cooper. Van Nistelrooy was quickly linked with the role, with confirmation of his appointment coming on Friday night.

United players were said to be impressed with the Dutchman during his time coaching at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford). And two members of the United squad have shown that with their activity on social media.

Both defender [Harry Maguire](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/harry-maguire) and winger [Amad](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/amad-diallo) have ‘liked’ Leicester’s official announcement of Van Nistelrooy’s appointment on social media. Maguire also has a link between the two clubs with the defender playing for Leicester for two seasons before joining United.

> [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/p/DC92PFcBkHX/embed)

[Speaking about his appointment at Leicester](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-first-words-30484872), Van Nistelrooy said: "I’m proud, I’m excited. Everybody that I speak to about Leicester City Football Club is enthusiastic.

"They have great stories about the quality of the people working at the club, the supporters and, of course, the recent history of the club is impressive. I’m excited to start and to get to know everyone and give everything I can for the football club.

"It’s also something I hear a lot about. I can’t wait to find that out, to be part of the Club, in a manager role, which is a big responsibility. I take it very seriously. Also, getting to know everybody, the community and the supporters, I can only imagine what it means to them. I want to feel it.”

Manchester United duo show true Ruud van Nistelrooy feelings after new job confirmed
====================================================================================

The latest Manchester United news as the former striker and United coach has joined Leicester City as first team manager.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

By

*   21:15, 29 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Leicester City unveil their new manager Ruud van Nistelrooy.](https://i2-prod.football.london/incoming/article30485216.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Leicester-City-Unveil-Their-New-Manager-Ruud-van-Nistelrooy.jpg)

Ruud van Nistelrooy has become the new manager of Leicester City following his exit from Manchester United. (Image: Plumb Images/Leicester City FC via Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Just over two weeks after leaving [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc), [Ruud van Nistelrooy](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruud-van-nistelrooy) has been confirmed as the new Leicester City manager.

The United legend has signed a deal until 2027, and will take charge of his first game when West Ham visit the King Power Stadium on Tuesday night. He will have a watching brief for the weekend’s clash against Brentford at the G-Tech Community Stadium.

His arrival at Leicester comes after he spent the first part of the season as assistant to [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) at United. Van Nistelrooy then took interim charge of the team for four games following the sacking of Ten Hag.

**READ MORE: [Ruud van Nistelrooy first words as new job confirmed and Man United reunion date set](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-first-words-30484872)**

**READ MORE: [Ruben Amorim's first Man United transfer move could hand Man City millions](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruben-amorims-first-man-united-30484565)**

In those games, United won three and drew just one. Ironically, two of the wins came against Leicester, [a 5-2 victory in the Carabao Cup](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-player-ratings-vs-30265661) and [a 3-0 win](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-player-ratings-amad-30338793) in the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league).

Leicester made the decision to make a managerial change on Sunday when they parted ways with Steve Cooper. Van Nistelrooy was quickly linked with the role, with confirmation of his appointment coming on Friday night.

United players were said to be impressed with the Dutchman during his time coaching at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford). And two members of the United squad have shown that with their activity on social media.

Both defender [Harry Maguire](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/harry-maguire) and winger [Amad](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/amad-diallo) have ‘liked’ Leicester’s official announcement of Van Nistelrooy’s appointment on social media. Maguire also has a link between the two clubs with the defender playing for Leicester for two seasons before joining United.

> [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/p/DC92PFcBkHX/embed)

[Speaking about his appointment at Leicester](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-first-words-30484872), Van Nistelrooy said: "I’m proud, I’m excited. Everybody that I speak to about Leicester City Football Club is enthusiastic.

"They have great stories about the quality of the people working at the club, the supporters and, of course, the recent history of the club is impressive. I’m excited to start and to get to know everyone and give everything I can for the football club.

"It’s also something I hear a lot about. I can’t wait to find that out, to be part of the Club, in a manager role, which is a big responsibility. I take it very seriously. Also, getting to know everybody, the community and the supporters, I can only imagine what it means to them. I want to feel it.”

data: {"title":"Man Utd duo show true Ruud van Nistelrooy feelings after new job confirmed","description":"The latest Manchester United news as the former striker and United coach has joined Leicester City as first team manager.","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-duo-show-true-30485198","content":"Manchester United duo show true Ruud van Nistelrooy feelings after new job confirmed - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                  

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Manchester United duo show true Ruud van Nistelrooy feelings after new job confirmed
====================================================================================

The latest Manchester United news as the former striker and United coach has joined Leicester City as first team manager.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments1](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-duo-show-true-30485198#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Amie Wilson](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/amie-wilson/)

*   21:15, 29 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Leicester City unveil their new manager Ruud van Nistelrooy.](https://i2-prod.football.london/incoming/article30485216.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Leicester-City-Unveil-Their-New-Manager-Ruud-van-Nistelrooy.jpg)

Ruud van Nistelrooy has become the new manager of Leicester City following his exit from Manchester United. (Image: Plumb Images/Leicester City FC via Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Just over two weeks after leaving [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc), [Ruud van Nistelrooy](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruud-van-nistelrooy) has been confirmed as the new Leicester City manager.

The United legend has signed a deal until 2027, and will take charge of his first game when West Ham visit the King Power Stadium on Tuesday night. He will have a watching brief for the weekend’s clash against Brentford at the G-Tech Community Stadium.

His arrival at Leicester comes after he spent the first part of the season as assistant to [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) at United. Van Nistelrooy then took interim charge of the team for four games following the sacking of Ten Hag.

**READ MORE: [Ruud van Nistelrooy first words as new job confirmed and Man United reunion date set](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-first-words-30484872)**

**READ MORE: [Ruben Amorim's first Man United transfer move could hand Man City millions](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruben-amorims-first-man-united-30484565)**

In those games, United won three and drew just one. Ironically, two of the wins came against Leicester, [a 5-2 victory in the Carabao Cup](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-player-ratings-vs-30265661) and [a 3-0 win](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-player-ratings-amad-30338793) in the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league).

Leicester made the decision to make a managerial change on Sunday when they parted ways with Steve Cooper. Van Nistelrooy was quickly linked with the role, with confirmation of his appointment coming on Friday night.

United players were said to be impressed with the Dutchman during his time coaching at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford). And two members of the United squad have shown that with their activity on social media.

Both defender [Harry Maguire](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/harry-maguire) and winger [Amad](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/amad-diallo) have ‘liked’ Leicester’s official announcement of Van Nistelrooy’s appointment on social media. Maguire also has a link between the two clubs with the defender playing for Leicester for two seasons before joining United.

> [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/p/DC92PFcBkHX/embed)

[Speaking about his appointment at Leicester](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-first-words-30484872), Van Nistelrooy said: "I’m proud, I’m excited. Everybody that I speak to about Leicester City Football Club is enthusiastic.

"They have great stories about the quality of the people working at the club, the supporters and, of course, the recent history of the club is impressive. I’m excited to start and to get to know everyone and give everything I can for the football club.

"It’s also something I hear a lot about. I can’t wait to find that out, to be part of the Club, in a manager role, which is a big responsibility. I take it very seriously. Also, getting to know everybody, the community and the supporters, I can only imagine what it means to them. I want to feel it.”

Manchester United duo show true Ruud van Nistelrooy feelings after new job confirmed
====================================================================================

The latest Manchester United news as the former striker and United coach has joined Leicester City as first team manager.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

By

[Amie Wilson](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/amie-wilson/)

*   21:15, 29 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Leicester City unveil their new manager Ruud van Nistelrooy.](https://i2-prod.football.london/incoming/article30485216.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Leicester-City-Unveil-Their-New-Manager-Ruud-van-Nistelrooy.jpg)

Ruud van Nistelrooy has become the new manager of Leicester City following his exit from Manchester United. (Image: Plumb Images/Leicester City FC via Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Just over two weeks after leaving [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc), [Ruud van Nistelrooy](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruud-van-nistelrooy) has been confirmed as the new Leicester City manager.

The United legend has signed a deal until 2027, and will take charge of his first game when West Ham visit the King Power Stadium on Tuesday night. He will have a watching brief for the weekend’s clash against Brentford at the G-Tech Community Stadium.

His arrival at Leicester comes after he spent the first part of the season as assistant to [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) at United. Van Nistelrooy then took interim charge of the team for four games following the sacking of Ten Hag.

**READ MORE: [Ruud van Nistelrooy first words as new job confirmed and Man United reunion date set](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-first-words-30484872)**

**READ MORE: [Ruben Amorim's first Man United transfer move could hand Man City millions](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruben-amorims-first-man-united-30484565)**

In those games, United won three and drew just one. Ironically, two of the wins came against Leicester, [a 5-2 victory in the Carabao Cup](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-player-ratings-vs-30265661) and [a 3-0 win](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-player-ratings-amad-30338793) in the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league).

Leicester made the decision to make a managerial change on Sunday when they parted ways with Steve Cooper. Van Nistelrooy was quickly linked with the role, with confirmation of his appointment coming on Friday night.

United players were said to be impressed with the Dutchman during his time coaching at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford). And two members of the United squad have shown that with their activity on social media.

Both defender [Harry Maguire](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/harry-maguire) and winger [Amad](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/amad-diallo) have ‘liked’ Leicester’s official announcement of Van Nistelrooy’s appointment on social media. Maguire also has a link between the two clubs with the defender playing for Leicester for two seasons before joining United.

> [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/p/DC92PFcBkHX/embed)

[Speaking about his appointment at Leicester](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-first-words-30484872), Van Nistelrooy said: "I’m proud, I’m excited. Everybody that I speak to about Leicester City Football Club is enthusiastic.

"They have great stories about the quality of the people working at the club, the supporters and, of course, the recent history of the club is impressive. I’m excited to start and to get to know everyone and give everything I can for the football club.

"It’s also something I hear a lot about. I can’t wait to find that out, to be part of the Club, in a manager role, which is a big responsibility. I take it very seriously. Also, getting to know everybody, the community and the supporters, I can only imagine what it means to them. I want to feel it.”

The staggering £86m Manchester United sum that INEOS wants to avoid
===================================================================

Manchester United have spent huge sums in disposing of managerial, coaching staff, and club executive contracts
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments1](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/staggering-86m-manchester-united-sum-30474842#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Dave Powell](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/dave-powell/)

*   03:00, 29 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Sir Jim Ratcliffe before Manchester United's win over Leicester earlier this month](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30468175.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Sir-Jim-Ratcliffe.jpg)

Sir Jim Ratcliffe before Manchester United's win over Leicester earlier this month (Image: Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

The era of excess at Manchester United appears to be over, with minority owner [Sir Jim Ratcliffe](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/sir-jim-ratcliffe) and INEOS having wasted little time over the last 11 months in ringing the changes at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) behind the scenes.

Some 250 staff were made redundant earlier in the year, while certain ‘perks’ that had existed for club official were removed, including the use of the club credit card. Ratcliffe, handed football and strategy oversight following the acquisition of 27.7% of the football club from the Glazer family, was doubling down on his intention to stop the haemorrhaging of cash while the team continued to fail competitively.

His willingness to keep faith in [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) for so long, agreeing to an extension at the end of last season despite many question marks over the Dutchman’s suitability for the top job at United, was, perhaps, a sign of Ratcliffe wanting to avoid the ‘hire em, fire em’ culture that had maybe been previously seen. In the end it was unavoidable and the publishing of the club’s first-quarter financial results earlier this week showed the financial strain.

**READ MORE:** **[Glazers despised, Ratcliffe on verge, tourist supporters - Man United ticket protest claims](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/glazers-despised-ratcliffe-verge-tourist-30469102)**

**READ MORE:** **[United boss Ruben Amorim drops Luke Shaw hint ahead of Bodo/Glimt fixture](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-boss-ruben-amorim-30468035)**

The dismissal of ten Hag, along with the exits of his coaching staff, cost the club £11.4m, while the compensation required to bring his replacement, Ruben Amorim, to Old Trafford from Sporting CP came in at around £10m.

Football finance expert Kieran Maguire crunched some of the numbers over the past 10 years at United, highlighting that in sacking managers, coaching staff and parting ways with club officials such as Richard Arnold, the club had burned through £86.2m on those exercises alone, and that figure did not include the compensation paid to Newcastle United to acquire the services of sporting director [Dan Ashworth.](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/dan-ashworth)

After Sir [Alex Ferguson](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/sir-alex-ferguson) retired in 2013 there was a cost of some £2.4m in redundancies related to his departure, while his successor, David Moyes, was sacked a day after the club failed to make the UEFA [Champions League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/uefa-champions-league) the following season, meaning he was only entitled to one-year redundancy, which still came in at £4.9m.

Louis van Gaal was the next incumbent, and when he departed in 2016 he was paid £8.4m, while the man who replaced him, [Jose Mourinho](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/jose-mourinho), was handed a £19.6m sum when he left in 2019.

[](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)[Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-co-owner-sir-30399941?int_source=mantis_rec&int_medium=web&int_campaign=more_like_this_comments#comments-wrapper "Comments")

The exits of Ole-Gunnar Solskjaer, Ralf Rangnick and former vice-chairman Ed Woodward all added another £23.8m to the running total, while Arnold and other club executives left earlier this year to see the club burn through another £5.7m.

The decision to extend ten Hag’s deal turned out to be financial folly, although the desire to allow himself time to turn things around pointed to a reluctance to waste more money on the disposal of managerial contracts.

The hope for INEOS is that Amorim is the man to be able to return the club to the summit of European football once more, but he faces having to it while likely having to adopt a more frugal approach in the transfer market.

**Premier League fans have reacted on social media after watching Brighton and Hove Albion against Southampton.**

On Friday night, the [Premier League](https://www.sportbible.com/premier-league) returned at the AMEX Stadium as high-flying Seagulls welcomed the Saints.

Perhaps as expected, [Brighton](https://www.sportbible.com/brighton-and-hove-albion) dominated the match early on and went ahead in the 29th minute thanks to Kaoru Mitoma.

Advert

In the second half, [Southampton](https://www.sportbible.com/southampton) hit back with Flynn Downes scoring in the 59th minute.

Reacting on social media, fans were raving about the performance of Saints young star Tyler Dibling, who has impressed again.

One fan said: "Southampton will be relegated but Tyler Dibling will still be in the Premier League next season. What a player."

Advert

Another tweeted: "@ManUtd act quick and sign Tyler Dibling, What a baller."

A third fan added: "Tyler Dibling is one of my favourite footballers to watch right now, hope he has a great career."

Someone else wrote: "Tyler Dibling is a baller. Big money move incoming soon."

A fifth commented: "Tyler dibling is a sensational baller! what a kid!"

Advert

Another fan said: "Tyler Dibling is OUTRAGEOUS."

18-year-old Dibling impressed during last weekend's defeat against Liverpool after winning a penalty in the first half and continued his fine form at the AMEX, often carrying the ball forward for the Saints and driving at the Brighton defence.

Ruben Amorim reaction to Manchester United player shows he is starting to get what he wants
===========================================================================================

Man United came from behind to secure their first win under Ruben Amorim against Bodo/Glimt in the Europa League.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

![Image 1: Samuel Luckhurst](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article22855086.ece/ALTERNATES/s98/0_WhatsApp-Image-2022-01-24-at-140305.jpg)

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

[Samuel Luckhurst](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/samuel-luckhurst/)Chief Manchester United writer

*   22:08, 28 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 2: Ruben Amorim celebrates](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30476263.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186679068.jpg)

Ruben Amorim celebrates

![Image 3: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Edric Connor's dulcet tones crooned the Manchester United Calypso on the Old Trafford airwaves before kick-off. The football taught now is by Ruben Amorim.

[United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) navigated six changes, a half-time substitution, brief switches in formation and a one-goal deficit to secure a first win under Amorim. This United is a work in progress and sterner tests await.

The players had to think on their feet against the underrated Bodo/Glimt, a team that riled Jose Mourinho a few years ago. United will likely encounter more obdurate opponents in unambitious Everton on Sunday in a very different examination.

Andre Onana resorted to time-wasting before added time and Amorim, ever present in the technical area, was often anxiously on his haunches. The referee charitably added only three more minutes. Casemiro diced with death outside his area with a handball. Onana punched Patrick Berg's free-kick away.

**READ MORE: [Ratings vs Bodo/Glimt as Hojlund good](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-player-ratings-rasmus-30475897)**

**READ MORE: [United vs Bodo/Glimt as it happened](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-bodo-glimt-live-30468119)**

The 3-4-3 system was not entirely abandoned but United switched to a more conventional, tried and trusted back four without the ball after sieving two goals in the first half. Ironically, they ended the contest without a centre back on the pitch as Casemiro replaced the cumbersome Matthijs de Ligt.

Amorim dicily decided to make all five substitutions before the 70-minute mark. Out of possession, the back four ended up as Noussair Mazraoui, Casemiro, Luke Shaw and Diogo Dalot.

Casemiro's lax reaction to Dalot's loose pass played Andre Onana into trouble. Bodo's staff in their dugout and the analysts in the press box were up in arms after the ball hit Onana's hand outside the area in the 76th minute.

Amorim's maiden victory was made possible by one of his changes. Rasmus Hojlund doubled his tally for the campaign and Alejandro Garnacho's first-minute goal was down to Hojlund's hard yards to leave the Argentine with a vacant net. Hojlund's involvement in all three goals - pressing, technique and instinct - showcased different qualities United need to see more often from their number nine.

Hojlund received that number over Joshua Zirkzee for several reasons and he is on trial over the next six months to gauge whether a prolific goalscorer-in-making is currently on United's books. This was an uplifting night for the Dane against the Norwegians.

Amorim expected a good challenge from Bodo due to their work-rate and Mason Mount was one of the busiest in red. He earned a bullish chest-bump and pat from his coach when he made way. Slowly, Amorim is getting what he wants. This was Mount's first start in 96 days and he acquitted himself promisingly in a position and system he is familiar with from Thomas Tuchel's tenure at Chelsea.

David Moyes received an undeserved fixed banner on the Stretford End 11 years ago. The 'Bem-vindo a casa Ruben' - welcome home Ruben - tricolor that was unfurled in the stand's first tier is temporary. The 'a casa' was barely readable due to the slanted unveiling.

European nights are still relatively low key, even for a United manager or head coach's debut. There was warm, if not rapturous, applause for Amorim upon his emergence.

The United followers were louder 48 seconds into the contest. Amorim barely celebrated Garnacho's goal and instead coolly took a swig from a water bottle on a night many donned thermals inside the ground.

Garnacho's goal was his eighth of a decent campaign. He will feel he should have already broken double figures and surpassed his ten-goal haul of last season. There were two more presentable opportunities where he failed to hit the target. Perhaps fortunate to retain his place amid six changes, he still continued his penchant for following up a negative performance with a positive one in under a minute.

Hojlund merits the credit for forcing the appalling error from goalkeeper Nikita Haikin through pressing. That is something Marcus Rashford seldom offers and Hojlund, for all his shortcomings, is a workaholic who runs himself into the ground.

Manuel Ugarte was paired with a different midfielder in Bruno Fernandes, relocated to a deeper position. Amorim urged the midfield duo not to become too detached from the back three yet minutes later the gap was too wide when United were brilliantly breached by Hakon Evjen for the equaliser. Onana complained the defensive shield was inadequate and he had a point.

This was Tyrell Malacia's first start in 550 days and it was too soon. It may crush Malacia's confidence that he was outpaced so effortlessly by Philip Zinckernagel as he put Bodo ahead. That was the first true endurance test for Malacia since his recovery from two knee operations and he was patently slower than before he went under the knife.

De Ligt, another Dutch arrival under Erik ten Hag, inexplicably failed to anticipate Zinckernagel's superiority. By the time he slid in, the ball was goalbound. Amorim directed his ire at Lisandro Martinez for going walkabout and leaving Malacia exposed. Amorim reached for the water bottle again and this time had to keep his cool. Or resist kicking it. Malacia made way for Dalot at the interval.

By the 29th minute, Bodo fans were chanting 'Olé'. Antony and Manuel Ugarte irked the United supporters with backward passes. Mazraoui, a hitherto successful signing by Ten Hag, ensured the half-time shrill would not be soundtracked to boos with some nifty footwork and cross for Hojlund to score. He started the second half as he ended the first with another.

===============
                                  

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

Ruben Amorim reaction to Manchester United player shows he is starting to get what he wants
===========================================================================================

Man United came from behind to secure their first win under Ruben Amorim against Bodo/Glimt in the Europa League.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments2](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-reaction-manchester-united-30475907#comments-wrapper "Comments")

![Image 1: Samuel Luckhurst](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article22855086.ece/ALTERNATES/s98/0_WhatsApp-Image-2022-01-24-at-140305.jpg)

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

[Samuel Luckhurst](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/samuel-luckhurst/)Chief Manchester United writer

*   22:08, 28 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 2: Ruben Amorim celebrates](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30476263.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186679068.jpg)

Ruben Amorim celebrates

![Image 3: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Edric Connor's dulcet tones crooned the Manchester United Calypso on the Old Trafford airwaves before kick-off. The football taught now is by Ruben Amorim.

[United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) navigated six changes, a half-time substitution, brief switches in formation and a one-goal deficit to secure a first win under Amorim. This United is a work in progress and sterner tests await.

The players had to think on their feet against the underrated Bodo/Glimt, a team that riled Jose Mourinho a few years ago. United will likely encounter more obdurate opponents in unambitious Everton on Sunday in a very different examination.

Andre Onana resorted to time-wasting before added time and Amorim, ever present in the technical area, was often anxiously on his haunches. The referee charitably added only three more minutes. Casemiro diced with death outside his area with a handball. Onana punched Patrick Berg's free-kick away.

**READ MORE: [Ratings vs Bodo/Glimt as Hojlund good](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-player-ratings-rasmus-30475897)**

**READ MORE: [United vs Bodo/Glimt as it happened](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-bodo-glimt-live-30468119)**

The 3-4-3 system was not entirely abandoned but United switched to a more conventional, tried and trusted back four without the ball after sieving two goals in the first half. Ironically, they ended the contest without a centre back on the pitch as Casemiro replaced the cumbersome Matthijs de Ligt.

Amorim dicily decided to make all five substitutions before the 70-minute mark. Out of possession, the back four ended up as Noussair Mazraoui, Casemiro, Luke Shaw and Diogo Dalot.

Casemiro's lax reaction to Dalot's loose pass played Andre Onana into trouble. Bodo's staff in their dugout and the analysts in the press box were up in arms after the ball hit Onana's hand outside the area in the 76th minute.

Amorim's maiden victory was made possible by one of his changes. Rasmus Hojlund doubled his tally for the campaign and Alejandro Garnacho's first-minute goal was down to Hojlund's hard yards to leave the Argentine with a vacant net. Hojlund's involvement in all three goals - pressing, technique and instinct - showcased different qualities United need to see more often from their number nine.

Hojlund received that number over Joshua Zirkzee for several reasons and he is on trial over the next six months to gauge whether a prolific goalscorer-in-making is currently on United's books. This was an uplifting night for the Dane against the Norwegians.

Amorim expected a good challenge from Bodo due to their work-rate and Mason Mount was one of the busiest in red. He earned a bullish chest-bump and pat from his coach when he made way. Slowly, Amorim is getting what he wants. This was Mount's first start in 96 days and he acquitted himself promisingly in a position and system he is familiar with from Thomas Tuchel's tenure at Chelsea.

David Moyes received an undeserved fixed banner on the Stretford End 11 years ago. The 'Bem-vindo a casa Ruben' - welcome home Ruben - tricolor that was unfurled in the stand's first tier is temporary. The 'a casa' was barely readable due to the slanted unveiling.

European nights are still relatively low key, even for a United manager or head coach's debut. There was warm, if not rapturous, applause for Amorim upon his emergence.

The United followers were louder 48 seconds into the contest. Amorim barely celebrated Garnacho's goal and instead coolly took a swig from a water bottle on a night many donned thermals inside the ground.

Garnacho's goal was his eighth of a decent campaign. He will feel he should have already broken double figures and surpassed his ten-goal haul of last season. There were two more presentable opportunities where he failed to hit the target. Perhaps fortunate to retain his place amid six changes, he still continued his penchant for following up a negative performance with a positive one in under a minute.

Hojlund merits the credit for forcing the appalling error from goalkeeper Nikita Haikin through pressing. That is something Marcus Rashford seldom offers and Hojlund, for all his shortcomings, is a workaholic who runs himself into the ground.

Manuel Ugarte was paired with a different midfielder in Bruno Fernandes, relocated to a deeper position. Amorim urged the midfield duo not to become too detached from the back three yet minutes later the gap was too wide when United were brilliantly breached by Hakon Evjen for the equaliser. Onana complained the defensive shield was inadequate and he had a point.

This was Tyrell Malacia's first start in 550 days and it was too soon. It may crush Malacia's confidence that he was outpaced so effortlessly by Philip Zinckernagel as he put Bodo ahead. That was the first true endurance test for Malacia since his recovery from two knee operations and he was patently slower than before he went under the knife.

De Ligt, another Dutch arrival under Erik ten Hag, inexplicably failed to anticipate Zinckernagel's superiority. By the time he slid in, the ball was goalbound. Amorim directed his ire at Lisandro Martinez for going walkabout and leaving Malacia exposed. Amorim reached for the water bottle again and this time had to keep his cool. Or resist kicking it. Malacia made way for Dalot at the interval.

By the 29th minute, Bodo fans were chanting 'Olé'. Antony and Manuel Ugarte irked the United supporters with backward passes. Mazraoui, a hitherto successful signing by Ten Hag, ensured the half-time shrill would not be soundtracked to boos with some nifty footwork and cross for Hojlund to score. He started the second half as he ended the first with another.

===============
                                  

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

Ruben Amorim reaction to Manchester United player shows he is starting to get what he wants
===========================================================================================

Man United came from behind to secure their first win under Ruben Amorim against Bodo/Glimt in the Europa League.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*

*   

*   [Comments2](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-reaction-manchester-united-30475907#comments-wrapper "Comments")

![Image 1: Samuel Luckhurst](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article22855086.ece/ALTERNATES/s98/0_WhatsApp-Image-2022-01-24-at-140305.jpg)

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

[Samuel Luckhurst](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/samuel-luckhurst/)Chief Manchester United writer

*   22:08, 28 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 2: Ruben Amorim celebrates](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30476263.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186679068.jpg)

Ruben Amorim celebrates

![Image 3: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Edric Connor's dulcet tones crooned the Manchester United Calypso on the Old Trafford airwaves before kick-off. The football taught now is by Ruben Amorim.

[United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) navigated six changes, a half-time substitution, brief switches in formation and a one-goal deficit to secure a first win under Amorim. This United is a work in progress and sterner tests await.

The players had to think on their feet against the underrated Bodo/Glimt, a team that riled Jose Mourinho a few years ago. United will likely encounter more obdurate opponents in unambitious Everton on Sunday in a very different examination.

Andre Onana resorted to time-wasting before added time and Amorim, ever present in the technical area, was often anxiously on his haunches. The referee charitably added only three more minutes. Casemiro diced with death outside his area with a handball. Onana punched Patrick Berg's free-kick away.

**READ MORE: [Ratings vs Bodo/Glimt as Hojlund good](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-player-ratings-rasmus-30475897)**

**READ MORE: [United vs Bodo/Glimt as it happened](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-bodo-glimt-live-30468119)**

The 3-4-3 system was not entirely abandoned but United switched to a more conventional, tried and trusted back four without the ball after sieving two goals in the first half. Ironically, they ended the contest without a centre back on the pitch as Casemiro replaced the cumbersome Matthijs de Ligt.

Amorim dicily decided to make all five substitutions before the 70-minute mark. Out of possession, the back four ended up as Noussair Mazraoui, Casemiro, Luke Shaw and Diogo Dalot.

Casemiro's lax reaction to Dalot's loose pass played Andre Onana into trouble. Bodo's staff in their dugout and the analysts in the press box were up in arms after the ball hit Onana's hand outside the area in the 76th minute.

Amorim's maiden victory was made possible by one of his changes. Rasmus Hojlund doubled his tally for the campaign and Alejandro Garnacho's first-minute goal was down to Hojlund's hard yards to leave the Argentine with a vacant net. Hojlund's involvement in all three goals - pressing, technique and instinct - showcased different qualities United need to see more often from their number nine.

Hojlund received that number over Joshua Zirkzee for several reasons and he is on trial over the next six months to gauge whether a prolific goalscorer-in-making is currently on United's books. This was an uplifting night for the Dane against the Norwegians.

Amorim expected a good challenge from Bodo due to their work-rate and Mason Mount was one of the busiest in red. He earned a bullish chest-bump and pat from his coach when he made way. Slowly, Amorim is getting what he wants. This was Mount's first start in 96 days and he acquitted himself promisingly in a position and system he is familiar with from Thomas Tuchel's tenure at Chelsea.

David Moyes received an undeserved fixed banner on the Stretford End 11 years ago. The 'Bem-vindo a casa Ruben' - welcome home Ruben - tricolor that was unfurled in the stand's first tier is temporary. The 'a casa' was barely readable due to the slanted unveiling.

European nights are still relatively low key, even for a United manager or head coach's debut. There was warm, if not rapturous, applause for Amorim upon his emergence.

The United followers were louder 48 seconds into the contest. Amorim barely celebrated Garnacho's goal and instead coolly took a swig from a water bottle on a night many donned thermals inside the ground.

Garnacho's goal was his eighth of a decent campaign. He will feel he should have already broken double figures and surpassed his ten-goal haul of last season. There were two more presentable opportunities where he failed to hit the target. Perhaps fortunate to retain his place amid six changes, he still continued his penchant for following up a negative performance with a positive one in under a minute.

Hojlund merits the credit for forcing the appalling error from goalkeeper Nikita Haikin through pressing. That is something Marcus Rashford seldom offers and Hojlund, for all his shortcomings, is a workaholic who runs himself into the ground.

Manuel Ugarte was paired with a different midfielder in Bruno Fernandes, relocated to a deeper position. Amorim urged the midfield duo not to become too detached from the back three yet minutes later the gap was too wide when United were brilliantly breached by Hakon Evjen for the equaliser. Onana complained the defensive shield was inadequate and he had a point.

This was Tyrell Malacia's first start in 550 days and it was too soon. It may crush Malacia's confidence that he was outpaced so effortlessly by Philip Zinckernagel as he put Bodo ahead. That was the first true endurance test for Malacia since his recovery from two knee operations and he was patently slower than before he went under the knife.

De Ligt, another Dutch arrival under Erik ten Hag, inexplicably failed to anticipate Zinckernagel's superiority. By the time he slid in, the ball was goalbound. Amorim directed his ire at Lisandro Martinez for going walkabout and leaving Malacia exposed. Amorim reached for the water bottle again and this time had to keep his cool. Or resist kicking it. Malacia made way for Dalot at the interval.

By the 29th minute, Bodo fans were chanting 'Olé'. Antony and Manuel Ugarte irked the United supporters with backward passes. Mazraoui, a hitherto successful signing by Ten Hag, ensured the half-time shrill would not be soundtracked to boos with some nifty footwork and cross for Hojlund to score. He started the second half as he ended the first with another.

data: {"title":"Amorim reaction to Man United player shows he is starting to get what he wants","description":"Man United came from behind to secure their first win under Ruben Amorim against Bodo/Glimt in the Europa League.","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-reaction-manchester-united-30475907","content":"Ruben Amorim reaction to Manchester United player shows he is starting to get what he wants - Samuel Luckhurst - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                    

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

Ruben Amorim reaction to Manchester United player shows he is starting to get what he wants
===========================================================================================

Man United came from behind to secure their first win under Ruben Amorim against Bodo/Glimt in the Europa League.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments2](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-reaction-manchester-united-30475907#comments-wrapper "Comments")

![Image 1: Samuel Luckhurst](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article22855086.ece/ALTERNATES/s98/0_WhatsApp-Image-2022-01-24-at-140305.jpg)

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

[Samuel Luckhurst](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/samuel-luckhurst/)Chief Manchester United writer

*   22:08, 28 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 2: Ruben Amorim celebrates](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30476263.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186679068.jpg)

Ruben Amorim celebrates

![Image 3: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Edric Connor's dulcet tones crooned the Manchester United Calypso on the Old Trafford airwaves before kick-off. The football taught now is by Ruben Amorim.

[United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) navigated six changes, a half-time substitution, brief switches in formation and a one-goal deficit to secure a first win under Amorim. This United is a work in progress and sterner tests await.

The players had to think on their feet against the underrated Bodo/Glimt, a team that riled Jose Mourinho a few years ago. United will likely encounter more obdurate opponents in unambitious Everton on Sunday in a very different examination.

Andre Onana resorted to time-wasting before added time and Amorim, ever present in the technical area, was often anxiously on his haunches. The referee charitably added only three more minutes. Casemiro diced with death outside his area with a handball. Onana punched Patrick Berg's free-kick away.

**READ MORE: [Ratings vs Bodo/Glimt as Hojlund good](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-player-ratings-rasmus-30475897)**

**READ MORE: [United vs Bodo/Glimt as it happened](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-bodo-glimt-live-30468119)**

The 3-4-3 system was not entirely abandoned but United switched to a more conventional, tried and trusted back four without the ball after sieving two goals in the first half. Ironically, they ended the contest without a centre back on the pitch as Casemiro replaced the cumbersome Matthijs de Ligt.

Amorim dicily decided to make all five substitutions before the 70-minute mark. Out of possession, the back four ended up as Noussair Mazraoui, Casemiro, Luke Shaw and Diogo Dalot.

Casemiro's lax reaction to Dalot's loose pass played Andre Onana into trouble. Bodo's staff in their dugout and the analysts in the press box were up in arms after the ball hit Onana's hand outside the area in the 76th minute.

Amorim's maiden victory was made possible by one of his changes. Rasmus Hojlund doubled his tally for the campaign and Alejandro Garnacho's first-minute goal was down to Hojlund's hard yards to leave the Argentine with a vacant net. Hojlund's involvement in all three goals - pressing, technique and instinct - showcased different qualities United need to see more often from their number nine.

Hojlund received that number over Joshua Zirkzee for several reasons and he is on trial over the next six months to gauge whether a prolific goalscorer-in-making is currently on United's books. This was an uplifting night for the Dane against the Norwegians.

Amorim expected a good challenge from Bodo due to their work-rate and Mason Mount was one of the busiest in red. He earned a bullish chest-bump and pat from his coach when he made way. Slowly, Amorim is getting what he wants. This was Mount's first start in 96 days and he acquitted himself promisingly in a position and system he is familiar with from Thomas Tuchel's tenure at Chelsea.

David Moyes received an undeserved fixed banner on the Stretford End 11 years ago. The 'Bem-vindo a casa Ruben' - welcome home Ruben - tricolor that was unfurled in the stand's first tier is temporary. The 'a casa' was barely readable due to the slanted unveiling.

European nights are still relatively low key, even for a United manager or head coach's debut. There was warm, if not rapturous, applause for Amorim upon his emergence.

The United followers were louder 48 seconds into the contest. Amorim barely celebrated Garnacho's goal and instead coolly took a swig from a water bottle on a night many donned thermals inside the ground.

Garnacho's goal was his eighth of a decent campaign. He will feel he should have already broken double figures and surpassed his ten-goal haul of last season. There were two more presentable opportunities where he failed to hit the target. Perhaps fortunate to retain his place amid six changes, he still continued his penchant for following up a negative performance with a positive one in under a minute.

Hojlund merits the credit for forcing the appalling error from goalkeeper Nikita Haikin through pressing. That is something Marcus Rashford seldom offers and Hojlund, for all his shortcomings, is a workaholic who runs himself into the ground.

Manuel Ugarte was paired with a different midfielder in Bruno Fernandes, relocated to a deeper position. Amorim urged the midfield duo not to become too detached from the back three yet minutes later the gap was too wide when United were brilliantly breached by Hakon Evjen for the equaliser. Onana complained the defensive shield was inadequate and he had a point.

This was Tyrell Malacia's first start in 550 days and it was too soon. It may crush Malacia's confidence that he was outpaced so effortlessly by Philip Zinckernagel as he put Bodo ahead. That was the first true endurance test for Malacia since his recovery from two knee operations and he was patently slower than before he went under the knife.

De Ligt, another Dutch arrival under Erik ten Hag, inexplicably failed to anticipate Zinckernagel's superiority. By the time he slid in, the ball was goalbound. Amorim directed his ire at Lisandro Martinez for going walkabout and leaving Malacia exposed. Amorim reached for the water bottle again and this time had to keep his cool. Or resist kicking it. Malacia made way for Dalot at the interval.

By the 29th minute, Bodo fans were chanting 'Olé'. Antony and Manuel Ugarte irked the United supporters with backward passes. Mazraoui, a hitherto successful signing by Ten Hag, ensured the half-time shrill would not be soundtracked to boos with some nifty footwork and cross for Hojlund to score. He started the second half as he ended the first with another.

Ruud van Nistelrooy set to succeed Steve Cooper as Leicester manager
====================================================================

*   Cooper sacked last Sunday after defeat by Chelsea
*   Leicester are 16th in table, one point above drop zone

Ruud van Nistelrooy is poised to become the new Leicester City manager, making an almost immediate return to the Premier League [after leaving Manchester United](https://www.theguardian.com/football/2024/nov/11/ruud-van-nistelrooy-leaves-manchester-united-ruben-amorim).

Van Nistelrooy, a United hero, is expected to succeed Steve Cooper, [who was sacked last Sunday](https://www.theguardian.com/football/2024/nov/24/leicester-sack-manager-steve-cooper-after-five-months-in-charge). His last game was [a home defeat](https://www.theguardian.com/football/2024/nov/23/leicester-chelsea-premier-league-match-report) against his predecessor, Enzo Maresca, now in charge of the high-flying Chelsea.

[Steve Cooper’s tepid Leicester reign was doomed from the very start Read more](https://www.theguardian.com/football/who-scored-blog/2024/nov/27/steve-coopers-tepid-leicester-reign-was-doomed-from-the-very-start)

Leicester were interested in Graham Potter and Carlos Corberán before installing Cooper in the summer but this week the club held productive talks with Van Nistelrooy. The club were reluctant to pay compensation for a manager, making him an attractive option.

Van Nistelrooy previously had a short spell managing PSV Eindhoven, the club where he made his big breakthrough as a player, winning the Dutch Cup in 2023 [before resigning](https://www.theguardian.com/football/2023/may/24/ruud-van-nistelrooy-resigns-as-psv-manager-after-talks-over-internal-affairs), citing a lack of support within the club.

Leicester are 16th in the table, one point above the relegation zone. The Dutchman’s first game could be at Brentford on Saturday, before matches against West Ham, Brighton, Newcastle and Wolves.

Leicester’s players returned to training on Tuesday, led by the first-team coach Ben Dawson, who joined from Newcastle in the summer, after a Christmas party in Copenhagen, where players were filmed dancing at a nightclub in front of a sign that read: “Enzo I miss you.”

Van Nistelrooy joined United as an assistant coach in July but was appointed interim head coach after the sacking of Erik ten Hag and oversaw four games, winning three, drawing one.

[skip past newsletter promotion](https://www.theguardian.com/football/2024/nov/27/ruud-van-nistelrooy-set-to-succeed-steve-cooper-as-leicester-manager#EmailSignup-skip-link-8)after newsletter promotion

Two of Van Nistelrooy’s wins in the United dugout came against Leicester, with a 5-2 win in the Carabao Cup before a 3-0 league victory in his final match in caretaker charge.

Ruud van Nistelrooy set to succeed Steve Cooper as Leicester manager
====================================================================

*   Cooper sacked last Sunday after defeat by Chelsea
*   Leicester are 16th in table, one point above drop zone

![Image 3](https://assets.guim.co.uk/static/frontend/logos/red-blue-small-banner-faded.svg)![Image 4](https://assets.guim.co.uk/static/frontend/logos/red-blue-large-banner-faded.svg)

Pop your US news bubble
-----------------------

How the Guardian is different

Ruud van Nistelrooy is poised to become the new Leicester City manager, making an almost immediate return to the Premier League [after leaving Manchester United](https://www.theguardian.com/football/2024/nov/11/ruud-van-nistelrooy-leaves-manchester-united-ruben-amorim).

Van Nistelrooy, a United hero, is expected to succeed Steve Cooper, [who was sacked last Sunday](https://www.theguardian.com/football/2024/nov/24/leicester-sack-manager-steve-cooper-after-five-months-in-charge). His last game was [a home defeat](https://www.theguardian.com/football/2024/nov/23/leicester-chelsea-premier-league-match-report) against his predecessor, Enzo Maresca, now in charge of the high-flying Chelsea.

[![Image 5: Steve Cooper on the toucline.](https://i.guim.co.uk/img/media/636b41b488986368ca7b918d77f20b7777aa1d57/0_166_2700_1620/master/2700.jpg?width=460&quality=85&auto=format&fit=max&s=9485a73fb9844c04584f34958b2cdf2b) Steve Cooper’s tepid Leicester reign was doomed from the very start Read more](https://www.theguardian.com/football/who-scored-blog/2024/nov/27/steve-coopers-tepid-leicester-reign-was-doomed-from-the-very-start)

Leicester were interested in Graham Potter and Carlos Corberán before installing Cooper in the summer but this week the club held productive talks with Van Nistelrooy. The club were reluctant to pay compensation for a manager, making him an attractive option.

Van Nistelrooy previously had a short spell managing PSV Eindhoven, the club where he made his big breakthrough as a player, winning the Dutch Cup in 2023 [before resigning](https://www.theguardian.com/football/2023/may/24/ruud-van-nistelrooy-resigns-as-psv-manager-after-talks-over-internal-affairs), citing a lack of support within the club.

Leicester are 16th in the table, one point above the relegation zone. The Dutchman’s first game could be at Brentford on Saturday, before matches against West Ham, Brighton, Newcastle and Wolves.

Leicester’s players returned to training on Tuesday, led by the first-team coach Ben Dawson, who joined from Newcastle in the summer, after a Christmas party in Copenhagen, where players were filmed dancing at a nightclub in front of a sign that read: “Enzo I miss you.”

Van Nistelrooy joined United as an assistant coach in July but was appointed interim head coach after the sacking of Erik ten Hag and oversaw four games, winning three, drawing one.

[skip past newsletter promotion](https://www.theguardian.com/football/2024/nov/27/ruud-van-nistelrooy-set-to-succeed-steve-cooper-as-leicester-manager#EmailSignup-skip-link-8)after newsletter promotion

Two of Van Nistelrooy’s wins in the United dugout came against Leicester, with a 5-2 win in the Carabao Cup before a 3-0 league victory in his final match in caretaker charge.

**Subscribe to Soccer with Jonathan Wilson, a weekly newsletter from one of the world’s top soccer journalists.**

I’m lucky enough to have been able to turn a childhood soccer obsession into a 24-year career that has included 13 books, regular columns in the best publications in the world and regular namechecks on Ted Lasso.

Now, I’m writing a weekly newsletter about European football aimed at a US audience, and I hope you consider signing up for it. Each week, alongside my regular column in the Observer, the Guardian’s sister Sunday paper, I’ll be looking at the biggest stories from the weekend’s action, along with issues affecting the global game.

Subscribers can expect it in their inbox every Monday. It’s entirely free and quite straightforward to cancel, so why not subscribe now?

Jonathan Wilson
